programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
NCIS: New Orleans
Agenci NCIS: Nowy Orlean
NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
NCIS: New Orleans
Agenci NCIS: Nowy Orlean
NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
Knowing: Directed by Alex Proyas. With Nicolas Cage, Chandler Canterbury, Rose Byrne, Lara Robinson. M.I.T. professor John Koestler links a mysterious list of numbers from a time capsule to past and future disasters and sets out to prevent the ultimate catastrophe." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0448011/","name":"Knowing","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMyMjgyMDIyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjg3MjAyMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"M.I.T. professor John Koestler links a mysterious list of numbers from a time capsule to past and future disasters and sets out to prevent the ultimate catastrophe.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0448011/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pugmahorn"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Good, The Bad and the Ugly","reviewBody":"The good: Strong start to the movie, the plot hooks you in, excellent sound, confronting disaster scenes, haunting images, Rose Byrne, at times quite freaky, The Bad: Special effects looked like they were from a video game, ripped off basically every science fiction movie ever made, poor acting from Nic Cage, very predictable.

The Ugly: Last third of movie was shamefully ridiculous.

Summary: If you are a science fiction fan, you will probably not be able to resist seeing this movie. Be warned, you will think you are seeing the sci-fi great that you have been waiting for but mid way the film gets lost. You may very well groan out loud at the ending. This had the makings of a great movie but unfortunately it couldn't come up with the goods.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":228342,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2009-04-22","keywords":"end of the world,number,disaster,time capsule,code","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Knowing: TV Spot","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3391554329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI1NDU5OTYzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU4NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI1NDU5OTYzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTU4NjYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Here is the TV trailer for Knowing, directed by Alex Proyas and starring Nicholas Cage."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2425105/","name":"Chandler Canterbury"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0126284/","name":"Rose Byrne"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001639/","name":"Alex Proyas"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046206/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035535/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052515/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0669379/","name":"Ryne Douglas Pearson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1340000/","name":"Juliet Snowden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0925482/","name":"Stiles White"}],"duration":"PT2H1M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
NCIS: New Orleans
Agenci NCIS: Nowy Orlean
NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent="

Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. programme.title: Wojowniczka
programme.desc: Cykl prezentujący wyselekcjonowany zbiór najlepszych filmów krótkometrażowych. Wiele z nich nagrodzonych zostało prestiżowymi wyróżnieniami na międzynarodowych galach i festiwalach filmowych. Każde pasmo przedstawia kilka produkcji na dany temat.

programme.title: We mnie
programme.desc: Sandra (Małgorzata Gorol) świętuje swój wieczór panieński. Zbliża się dzień ślubu, ale przedtem musi poddać się aborcji - płód ma wady genetyczne. Do szpitala jedzie z nią narzeczony. Z każdą kolejną minutą mężczyzna wydaje się Sandrze coraz bardziej obcy. Po zabiegu kobieta postanawia szczerze z nim porozmawiać.

programme.title: Mój kraj taki piękny
programme.desc: W Polsce trwa spór pomiędzy dwoma ugrupowaniami - narodowcami i ich przeciwnikami. Grzegorz Paprzycki dokumentuje przebieg tych potyczek. Pojawia się w samym środku wydarzeń, podczas których niejednokrotnie dochodzi do aktów przemocy. Film stanowi subiektywne spojrzenie na konflikt, który toczy się na polskich ulicach. Za swój obraz reżyser otrzymał Złotego Lajkonika na Krakowskim Festiwalu Filmowym.

programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

programme.title: To, co zostaje
programme.desc: Marianna (Marta Ścisłowicz) i Jan (Piotr Czarniecki) wiodą szczęśliwe życie na wsi w północno-wschodniej Polsce. Pewnego dnia kobieta musi stawić czoła niespodziewanej śmierci męża. Wyrzuty sumienia i nagła strata sprawiają, że potrzebuje czasu, żeby pożegnać ukochanego. Zamyka się z jego ciałem w domu. Jej zachowanie spotyka się z niezrozumieniem mieszkańców wioski.

programme.desc: Un divan à Tunis: Directed by Manele Labidi. With Golshifteh Farahani, Majd Mastoura, Aïsha Ben Miled, Feryel Chammari. After years abroad in Paris, Selma returns to Tunis with the dream of opening up her own psychotherapy practice." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9648886/","name":"Un divan à Tunis","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc3MjRhNzctYWQ4OC00Nzg0LWIwMzYtYWVjN2ZmMjUyNTExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjgzMjQ0MTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"After years abroad in Paris, Selma returns to Tunis with the dream of opening up her own psychotherapy practice.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9648886/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"On the Couch","reviewBody":"The struggle to become something or someone .. to succeed in ones profession or dream/pursuit. And if you are a woman ... well the struggle can be even worse. Especially in some countries and situations. Not that we have reached real equality anywhere, but in some countries it is even worse than in others, when it comes to women being able to work however they want to.\n\nThat is just the basis, just one of the points the movie is making. Psychologically speaking there is more to it. Great central performance, great persistence, great fight for what she believes in. And really fun and interesting side stories of the ... side characters overall. Psychologically speaking there is more to it. Great central performance, great persistence, great fight for what she believes in. programme.title: Un beau voyou
Przebiegły złodziej
Un beau voyou
programme.desc:
Un beau voyou: Directed by Lucas Bernard. With Charles Berling, Swann Arlaud, Jennifer Decker, Jean-Quentin Châtelain. Beffrois aguardaba su jubilación con algo de entusiasmo cuando un ladrón de cuadros captó su atención." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7458798/","name":"Un beau voyou","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTYwMWU1NGUtYjk5OC00YTFlLTliOTItZTljOWFhNWQ5Y2JiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTc5OTMwOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Beffrois aguardaba su jubilación con algo de entusiasmo cuando un ladrón de cuadros captó su atención.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7458798/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Tu parles, Charles!","reviewBody":"First effort by Lucas Bernard ,both director and screenwriter;his work as a writer leaves a lot to be desired : his story is complicated instead of complex, full of plot holes ,and it's really difficult to pigeonhole the movie: a detective story? rehersals for retirement?(isn't it a bit ironical for a first work?)A (bland) love story?a depiction of social customs of contemporary times?A gibe at modern art ?A tribute to Arsene Lupin and to Louis Feuillade 's Musidora of the silent era?

It does not make a good movie for all that .In the first part ,every scene seems to be the beginning of the film ,and the cop's investigation ,apart from some good lines such as: "the robberies in museums are risky :try to flog "Mona lisa!";so robbery in the wealthy parvenus's houses is a better job.

Fortunately , there are actors who can save something from the wreckage :an actor who works on stage as well as in the movies ,Charles Berling is one of them ;without him ,I would have yawned my head off all along this bore .In my book,everything rests on his shoulders : wearing a wry smile, often overtaken by events (like the cops in old Arsene Lupin), ill at ease in those galleries of weirdoes (the "invitation") or nouveaux riches (our hero does not have a clue in art),he walks through the film like a tourist , rehearsing for retirement .Too subtle a thespian for the part , he nonetheless succeeds in making us feel his fear of retiring (his "I 'll take care of my grandchildren" does not convince anybody ,even himself ): for that matter ,the very old grandad "they don't know to do with "is an ominous prospect .

He may envy the "beau Voyou" (beautiful lout),his youth and his attractive girlfriend ,but he had the last laugh (the very last picture)."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":294,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-01-02","keywords":"female nudity,topless female nudity,female full rear nudity,barefoot woman,sex scene","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi959429145","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjkyZDA3MTUtODM4Ni00Yjg5LTllOGMtNzUzYTBkMTNhYzFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjkyZDA3MTUtODM4Ni00Yjg5LTllOGMtNzUzYTBkMTNhYzFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0075650/","name":"Charles Berling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0035128/","name":"Swann Arlaud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213847/","name":"Jennifer Decker"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1602696/","name":"Lucas Bernard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0519417/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044140/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0125554/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1602696/","name":"Lucas Bernard"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Matthias et Maxime
Matthias i Maxime
Matthias & Maxime
programme.desc: Matthias et Maxime: Directed by Xavier Dolan. With Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas, Xavier Dolan, Pier-Luc Funk, Samuel Gauthier. Hidden feelings come to light and threaten the bond of a group of friends in their late 20s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8767908/","name":"Matthias et Maxime","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAxODBiOGQtNjAwZi00ZTZlLTkwMjctODk4NmFkNGU3N2I1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA3MzQ4MTc0._V1_.jpg","description":"Hidden feelings come to light and threaten the bond of a group of friends in their late 20s.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8767908/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Smoulders but lacks a spark.","reviewBody":"I was rather disappointed by this effort from Xavier Dolan. Perhaps writing/editting and starring in the film robbed him too much of objectivity when it came to actually watching this bit of a non-story. He portrays "Max", a young French-Canadian man who is about to emigrate to Australia. At a party with his childhood friends, he and handsome best pal Matt (Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas) get lumbered with starring in a video being made by one of their number's pesky younger sister. The scene involved the two of them kissing - something neither had done (as an adult) with a man before. What ensues is a slow, deliberately so, depiction of the complications that this kiss has on their relationship. "Matt" has a long term girlfriend, so his reconciliation with his "new" feelings for his friend take on a different guise from those of the single "Max" who has issues with his recovering addict mother. Sadly, though, too much of those repercussions are presumed on us by the director and not demonstrated to the audience. It doesn't need to be a cheesy traditional romance, nor a sex fest, but we are left to imagine or envisage that they want each other only because we know that's what the film is about - not because we are presented with much tangible, or even implied, sense of desire. Indeed the others in their group more readily flirt and banter than the two in the title. It doesn't have a beginning, middle and end - it just has a middle. A rather interestingly filmed and quite well put together middle, but a middle nonetheless. IMDb data; ttnr: 8767908, Title: Matthias et Maxime, --- Description: Matthias et Maxime: Directed by Xavier Dolan. With Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas, Xavier Dolan, Pier-Luc Funk, Samuel Gauthier. Hidden feelings come to light and threaten the bond of a group of friends in their late 20s." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8767908/","name":"Matthias et Maxime","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAxODBiOGQtNjAwZi00ZTZlLTkwMjctODk4NmFkNGU3N2I1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA3MzQ4MTc0._V1_.jpg","description":"Hidden feelings come to light and threaten the bond of a group of friends in their late 20s.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8767908/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"CinemaSerf","dateCreated":"2020-09-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Smoulders but lacks a spark.","reviewBody":"I was rather disappointed by this effort from Xavier Dolan. Perhaps writing/editting and starring in the film robbed him too much of objectivity when it came to actually watching this bit of a non-story. He portrays "Max", a young French-Canadian man who is about to emigrate to Australia. At a party with his childhood friends, he and handsome best pal Matt (Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas) get lumbered with starring in a video being made by one of their number's pesky younger sister. The scene involved the two of them kissing - something neither had done (as an adult) with a man before. What ensues is a slow, deliberately so, depiction of the complications that this kiss has on their relationship. "Matt" has a long term girlfriend, so his reconciliation with his "new" feelings for his friend take on a different guise from those of the single "Max" who has issues with his recovering addict mother. Sadly, though, too much of those repercussions are presumed on us by the director and not demonstrated to the audience. It doesn't need to be a cheesy traditional romance, nor a sex fest, but we are left to imagine or envisage that they want each other only because we know that's what the film is about - not because we are presented with much tangible, or even implied, sense of desire. Indeed the others in their group more readily flirt and banter than the two in the title. It doesn't have a beginning, middle and end - it just has a middle. A rather interestingly filmed and quite well put together middle, but a middle nonetheless. Certainly worth watching - I think Dolan has something about him - but I wanted more from the characters and the story - as it is I just felt like a rather unsatisfied observer.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6595,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-10-09","keywords":"gay character,friendship,kiss,in love with best friend,mother son relationship","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi707182105","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNjNTgxYjYtNzI1OS00MzUwLWE5MTEtMjJhZDZhMTllZDQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNjNTgxYjYtNzI1OS00MzUwLWE5MTEtMjJhZDZhMTllZDQ0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8570499/","name":"Gabriel D'Almeida Freitas","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2954178/","name":"Pier-Luc Funk"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0489666/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053578/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0093053/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0230859/","name":"Xavier Dolan"],"duration":"PT1H59M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Traitor
Zdrajca
Traitor
programme.desc:
Traitor: Directed by Jeffrey Nachmanoff. With Don Cheadle, Guy Pearce, Saïd Taghmaoui, Neal McDonough. When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0988047/","name":"Traitor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MzI3NDY5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzI0NDY3MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0988047/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"valleyjohn"},"dateCreated":"2008-12-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"Entertaining but nothing new","reviewBody":"Back in my youth it was always the case that movie bad guys were pretty much an uncomplicated bunch. The enemy used to be either Red Indians or The Germans. Then came the IRA (for us Brits ) and the Russians . Sinister foe's who were willing to go that one step further for their cause. Since 9/11 a far more fearful enemy has appeared on the scene. A brain washed enemy that is willing to die in the name of religion - The fundamentalist Muslims . Because of the terrifying prospect of what they have done and what they could do again , Hollywood have jumped on the band wagon and profited from a string of movies about the subject . None of which have been outstanding yet most have been entertaining. Traitor fits perfectly in that bracket .

When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn. A mysterious figure with a web of connections to terrorist organizations, Horn has a knack for emerging on the scene just as a major operation goes down.

The inter-agency task force looking into the case meets with Carter,a veteran CIA contractor who seemingly has his own agenda and Max Archer, fellow FBI agent. The task force links Horn to a prison break in Yemen, a bombing in Nice and a raid in London, but a tangle of contradictory evidence emerges, forcing Clayton to question whether his quarry is a disaffected former military operative--or something far more complicated.

Obsessed with discovering the truth, Clayton tracks Horn across the globe as the elusive ex-soldier burrows deeper and deeper into a world of shadows and intrigue.

I like Don Cheadle. I can forgive him for one of the worst ever English accents in the Ocean's films because despite that he is normally very good at his trade. He was brilliant in Boogie Nights and i loved his performance Reign Over Me. His performance is probably the best thing about Traitor. 

Although thoroughly entertaining , this film has nothing new in it to recommend it any more than say - The Kingdom or Body of Lies - and if you have seen either of those films you have seen Traitor.

It's good to see Guy Pearce too . A highly underrated actor who has hardly put a foot wrong since his days in the extremely naff Australian Soap Opera "Neighbours". His best performance to date being the lead in the stunning movie "Momento". 

This film reminds me a lot of the US TV series " Sleeper Cell" . Don Cheadle's character is asked to basically do the same thing in this as Darwyn Al-Sayeed does did in that show.

To sum up traitor is 2 hours of fast flowing predictable fair that is hard to criticise but is also difficult heap praise on.

7 out of 10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":56936,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2008-08-27","keywords":"thanksgiving,aerial camera shot,fbi federal bureau of investigation,reference to muhammad,prison","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Traitor: Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi31719705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAwODc4ODMzMTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDY0NzcyNzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTAwODc4ODMzMTZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU3MDY0NzcyNzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is theatrical trailer for Traitor, directed by Jeffrey Nachmanoff."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000332/","name":"Don Cheadle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001602/","name":"Guy Pearce"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0659544/","name":"Archie Panjabi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0618680/","name":"Jeffrey Nachmanoff"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0193414/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064942/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0036225/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0618680/","name":"Jeffrey Nachmanoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Tu mérites un amour
Tu mérites un amour
programme.desc: Tu mérites un amour: Directed by Hafsia Herzi. With Hafsia Herzi, Djanis Bouzyani, Jérémie Laheurte, Anthony Bajon. After Rémi's infidelity, Lila has a hard time dealing with their break-up. One day, he announces that he will travel alone to Bolivia to try to understand his mistakes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10223546/","name":"Tu mérites un amour","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGE3ZWNjYTktMmMzOS00Y2MwLTgyNmEtZWQ4MGY5NDg1MzFkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODA1MzEyOTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"After Rémi's infidelity, Lila has a hard time dealing with their break-up. One day, he announces that he will travel alone to Bolivia to try to understand his mistakes.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10223546/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pieromonbo"},"dateCreated":"2020-08-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Such a good surprise! Very personal and charming movie.","reviewBody":"Many actual movies seem to me too professional and impersonal with an evident will to have an effect on the spectator. I don't like to be told what I have to feel as I'm watching a movie. That's why I liked so much "Tu mérites un amour". The director is a young woman Hafsia Herzi and it seems to be her first feature film after a short. She is also the main performer and has a rich experience as an actress. So I guess she didn't learn the job with theory and technical lessons but on the sets. It may explain her freedom and her sensibility, the way her camera loves her characters is truly moving, finding every time the right distance. A beautiful montage allows her to express in a very precise way, what she wants to tell about her characters. The subject is very thin, a young woman doesn't succeed in renouncing to a man that doesn't deserve her and cheats on her, and she deserves a love that she doesn't succeed in finding. I won't tell the end that doesn't much matter any way. Dialogues are excellent and funny. No morality preach about racism or intolerance for homosexuality; in fact no preach at all, but great portrayal of characters who try to find their way to happiness and love. Simple and straightforward but with a very delicate play of feelings.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":639,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-09-11","keywords":"title directed by female,directed by cast member,f rated,triple f rated,female protagonist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1901640729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNmY2YxMjktYTFhZS00NGVlLTlmNTAtNDVkMjg5Y2Q5ZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzNmY2YxMjktYTFhZS00NGVlLTlmNTAtNDVkMjg5Y2Q5ZDdmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2082567/","name":"Hafsia Herzi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4186329/","name":"Djanis Bouzyani"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5398167/","name":"Jérémie Laheurte"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2082567/","name":"Hafsia Herzi"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0762139/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0063732/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014456/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2082567/","name":"Hafsia Herzi"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Volontaire
Niezłomne serce
Volontaire
programme.desc:
Volontaire: Directed by Hélène Fillières. With Lambert Wilson, Diane Rouxel, Alex Descas, Corentin Fila. Laure, 23 years old, suddenly decides to join the French Navy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7146578/","name":"Volontaire","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODdmYTk0ZDEtZmE5My00YjQ3LWE3MzItOTQ1OTFiMjcyOGI1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc5OTQwMzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Laure, 23 years old, suddenly decides to join the French Navy.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7146578/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pxnier"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Subtle, intense, full of innuendo, not just another variation around a stereotype!","reviewBody":"The main actors are impeccable in the rendition of their respective characters. While we would expect it from a star of Lambert Wilson's caliber, Diane Rouxel is extremely credible in her portraying of the successful student with many diplomas and having lost sight of what she should be doing next.

I am older, so the French army was different then. Many of those who chose to embrace a career in it, did it for lack of better opportunities. And at the time, females were restricted to office work, if ever.

I found the depiction of the family relationship true and authentic. For having experienced it on first hand and observed and discussed it with the other recruits. Most of our parents were reluctant to have us chose the army over something "better". Most of us gave up on our sentimental lives quickly after we started training. Somehow, anything outside of the Army bubble became irrelevant.

Laure becomes entangled into her own emotions and feelings, and her motivation to get acceptance grows exponentially as the movie progresses.

Commander Rivière completely incarnates the gruff officer, ironclad and intransigent with everybody, himself included. Trying to hide some emotions that he perceives as weaknesses. We are surprised by his actions all the way to the end.

Obviously, not everything is perfect. This a budget limited movie. The "commando" training is much more demanding than what we are led to believe. Diane Rouxel's body hasn't got the muscles necessary to even attempt it. Mentally, I have seen ladies with the same "go getting" and more than male counterparts. However, part of being in a commando implies that you carry weapons and ammunition with you. This makes it a physical impossibility for someone who is said to weight only 120 lbs. Anyone of you who did the military knows how heavy ammunition is. Once it ends in your backpack, you have to take it with you, as with your main and reserve weapon. Even men with strong built struggle.

The fraternity that military people embrace is also shown, and the aggressive and competitive spirit there is when you do specialty training. This is something I lived to.

I recommend this movie. It does not let down and you get surprised to discover it is a little unknown gem in its own domain.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":366,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-06-06","keywords":"woman in military,military drill,boot camp,male objectification,f rated","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0933727/","name":"Lambert Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5864806/","name":"Diane Rouxel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0220976/","name":"Alex Descas"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277229/","name":"Hélène Fillières"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315631/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172053/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277229/","name":"Hélène Fillières"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2059904/","name":"Mathias Gavarry"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

While we would expect it from a star of Lambert Wilson's caliber, Diane Rouxel is extremely credible in her portraying of the successful student with many diplomas and having lost sight of what she should be doing next.

I am older, so the French army was different then. Many of those who chose to embrace a career in it, did it for lack of better opportunities. And at the time, females were restricted to office work, if ever.

I found the depiction of the family relationship true and authentic. For having experienced it on first hand and observed and discussed it with the other recruits. Most of our parents were reluctant to have us chose the army over something "better". Most of us gave up on our sentimental lives quickly after we started training. Somehow, anything outside of the Army bubble became irrelevant.

Laure becomes entangled into her own emotions and feelings, and her motivation to get acceptance grows exponentially as the movie progresses.

Commander Rivière completely incarnates the gruff officer, ironclad and intransigent with everybody, himself included. Trying to hide some emotions that he perceives as weaknesses. We are surprised by his actions all the way to the end.

Obviously, not everything is perfect. This a budget limited movie. The "commando" training is much more demanding than what we are led to believe. Diane Rouxel's body hasn't got the muscles necessary to even attempt it. Mentally, I have seen ladies with the same "go getting" and more than male counterparts. However, part of being in a commando implies that you carry weapons and ammunition with you. This makes it a physical impossibility for someone who is said to weight only 120 lbs. Anyone of you who did the military knows how heavy ammunition is. Once it ends in your backpack, you have to take it with you, as with your main and reserve weapon. Even men with strong built struggle.

The fraternity that military people embrace is also shown, and the aggressive and competitive spirit there is when you do specialty training. This is something I lived to.

I recommend this movie. programme.title: Hi, How Are You
programme.desc: Bezrobotny pięćdziesięcioletni Sławek (Jacek Poniedziałek) ma problem z zabiciem wolnego czasu. Mężczyzna przesiaduje w domu bądź włóczy się po osiedlu, szukając zaginionego kota. W najlepszym razie wykonuje różnego rodzaju prace zlecone mu przez żonę. Pewnego dnia Sławek poznaje tajemniczą sąsiadkę Kamilę (Maja Szopa). Kobieta zaprasza go do swojego ogrodu.

programme.title: Corporate Animals
Korpoludki
Corporate Animals
programme.desc:
Corporate Animals: Directed by Patrick Brice. With Demi Moore, Jessica Williams, Ed Helms, Karan Soni. CEO Lucy takes her staff on corporate team building in some underground desert caves in New Mexico. They get stuck there." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8366502/","name":"Corporate Animals","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGI4NDhmMTUtNTcwMC00OTY3LWIyYTItYWM5ZjNkZGM2ZjQzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"CEO Lucy takes her staff on corporate team building in some underground desert caves in New Mexico. They get stuck there.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8366502/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"something to chew on","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Filmmaker Patrick Brice is building a career on films that leave us with an unsettled, even conflicted feeling on whether we should "like" them or not. He certainly has little time for 'normal' characters, and heroic behavior rarely enters a scene. His latest is written by Sam Bain (PEEP SHOW, and son of Emmy winning director Bill Bain), and it fits perfectly into the offbeat comedy realm of Mr. Brice's previous two CREEP films (with Mark Duplass) and THE OVERNIGHT (2015).

The film kicks off was an advertisement (in the pre-production stage) for Incredible Edibles, a bio-friendly company that produces edible cutlery (a comical visual). Featured in the ad is the company's ruthless CEO Lucy, played by Demi Moore. Lucy has arranged a Team Building outing for her employees in the mountains of New Mexico. The expedition is led by Brandon (Ed Helms, THE HANGOVER), a Bear Gryllis type who easily evaluates the team's incongruent pieces. After advising against Lucy's demand for the "Advanced" trail, Brandon gives in since 'the check has cleared'. He proceeds to lead the team on a repelling adventure down into a stunning cavern.

Just when it looks like the "advanced" trail was the right call, a cave-in occurs, trapping the team with no escape route, and little food or water. It's at this point when we realize that most of Lucy's management style seems to have originated in a 'get tough' management book from the 1960's. She has no real instinct on how to treat people, and mostly just bullies and tricks them. Ms. Moore's character and performance could easily be viewed as a spoof of her DISCLOSURE role with some uncomfortable laughs. We even get a Harvey Weinstein punchline.

Noticeable right away is the terrific comedic cast. Lucy's team consists of Jess (Jessica Williams, BOOKSMART), Freddie (Karan Soni, DEADPOOL), Derek (Isiah Whitlock Jr, CEDAR RAPIDS), Gloria (Martha Kelly, "Baskets"), Billy (Dan Bakkedahl, SWORD OF TRUST), May (Jennifer Kim, "The Blacklist"), Suzy (Nasim Padrad, ALADDIN), and intern Aidan (Calum Worthy, "American Vandal"). This is an exceptionally talented group of funny people who know how to deliver a line. Some of the funniest moments are the 'throwaway' lines being uttered in between the main dialogue. That's where the real comedy gold is buried, so listen closely.

Although the film is a comedy, it also boasts some elements of horror and suspense. Lucy's twisted idealism is the basis for some of this, as is the team's situation as things become more dire (think ALIVE blended with any workplace comedy). We learn the company is teetering on financial failure, and as one might expect in a confined area, workplace resentments and true feelings begin to rear up. The script never quite takes on business satire, focusing instead on personal reactions to a bleak situation. Even Gary Sinise and Britney Spears are included in the comic elements, and while some will find this to be a fitting midnight movie, others will once again be left wondering what to make of Patrick Brice's films. And maybe that's the point.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3169,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Horror"],"datePublished":"2019-09-20","keywords":"male frontal nudity,male nudity,male full frontal nudity,pubic hair,male pubic hair","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3595353113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhiODdlMzMtY2Q1ZC00MTAyLTkxYzMtYTFhYmE5MTBlMGE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDhiODdlMzMtY2Q1ZC00MTAyLTkxYzMtYTFhYmE5MTBlMGE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lucy (Demi Moore) is the egotistical megalomaniac CEO of Incredible Edibles, America's premier provider of edible cutlery. In her infinite wisdom, Lucy leads her staff including her long-suffering assistants, Freddie (Karan Soni) and Jess (Jessica Williams), on a corporate team-building caving weekend to New Mexico. When disaster strikes, not even their useless guide, Brandon (Ed Helms), can save them. Trapped underground by a cave-in, this mismatched and disgruntled group must pull together in order to survive."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000193/","name":"Demi Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1790970/","name":"Jessica Williams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1159180/","name":"Ed Helms"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2674307/","name":"Patrick Brice"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0447391/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0228888/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0188303/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1095060/","name":"Sam Bain"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

They get stuck there.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8366502/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6","dateCreated":"2019-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"something to chew on","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. Filmmaker Patrick Brice is building a career on films that leave us with an unsettled, even conflicted feeling on whether we should "like" them or not. He certainly has little time for 'normal' characters, and heroic behavior rarely enters a scene. His latest is written by Sam Bain (PEEP SHOW, and son of Emmy winning director Bill Bain), and it fits perfectly into the offbeat comedy realm of Mr. Brice's previous two CREEP films (with Mark Duplass) and THE OVERNIGHT (2015).

The film kicks off was an advertisement (in the pre-production stage) for Incredible Edibles, a bio-friendly company that produces edible cutlery (a comical visual). Featured in the ad is the company's ruthless CEO Lucy, played by Demi Moore. Lucy has arranged a Team Building outing for her employees in the mountains of New Mexico. The expedition is led by Brandon (Ed Helms, THE HANGOVER), a Bear Gryllis type who easily evaluates the team's incongruent pieces. After advising against Lucy's demand for the "Advanced" trail, Brandon gives in since 'the check has cleared'. He proceeds to lead the team on a repelling adventure down into a stunning cavern.

Just when it looks like the "advanced" trail was the right call, a cave-in occurs, trapping the team with no escape route, and little food or water. It's at this point when we realize that most of Lucy's management style seems to have originated in a 'get tough' management book from the 1960's. She has no real instinct on how to treat people, and mostly just bullies and tricks them. Ms. Moore's character and performance could easily be viewed as a spoof of her DISCLOSURE role with some uncomfortable laughs. We even get a Harvey Weinstein punchline.

Noticeable right away is the terrific comedic cast. Lucy's team consists of Jess (Jessica Williams, BOOKSMART), Freddie (Karan Soni, DEADPOOL), Derek (Isiah Whitlock Jr, CEDAR RAPIDS), Gloria (Martha Kelly, "Baskets"), Billy (Dan Bakkedahl, SWORD OF TRUST), May (Jennifer Kim, "The Blacklist"), Suzy (Nasim Padrad, ALADDIN), and intern Aidan (Calum Worthy, "American Vandal"). This is an exceptionally talented group of funny people who know how to deliver a line. Some of the funniest moments are the 'throwaway' lines being uttered in between the main dialogue. That's where the real comedy gold is buried, so listen closely.

Although the film is a comedy, it also boasts some elements of horror and suspense. Lucy's twisted idealism is the basis for some of this, as is the team's situation as things become more dire (think ALIVE blended with any workplace comedy). We learn the company is teetering on financial failure, and as one might expect in a confined area, workplace resentments and true feelings begin to rear up. The script never quite takes on business satire, focusing instead on personal reactions to a bleak situation. Even Gary Sinise and Britney Spears are included in the comic elements, and while some will find this to be a fitting midnight movie, others will once again be left wondering what to make of Patrick Brice's films. programme.title: Get Carter
Dorwać Cartera
Get Carter
programme.desc: Get Carter: Directed by Stephen Kay. With Sylvester Stallone, Miranda Richardson, Rachael Leigh Cook, Rhona Mitra. A Las Vegas mob enforcer travels back to his hometown to investigate his brother's mysterious death." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0208988/","name":"Get Carter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkzMDk3Njg3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNTIzMzU3._V1_.jpg","description":"A Las Vegas mob enforcer travels back to his hometown to investigate his brother's mysterious death.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0208988/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"thinker1691"},"dateCreated":"2011-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"" I'm the kind of guy your mother warned you about "","reviewBody":"In 1971, the first of these action, violence prone films was offered. In the original novel, written by Ted Lewis, it was Michael Caine who was the unstoppable, revenge filled Gangster out to discover who killed his brother. In this updated version directed by Stephen Kay, we have Sylvester Stallone playing Jack Carter. Both versions were very well conceived. The updated film has added the blood, gore and non-stop drama which is common with newer versions. The story remains the same in that Carter (Stallone) learns his younger brother died under suspicious circumstances and he is determined to learn why. Along the way, he is met with business types who are not interested in helping Carter find the truth. To that end, John C. McGinley, Mickey Rourke and even Michael Caine get in the action. The movie is filled with dark sequences, black violence and thrilling chase scenes, all of which add to the final outcome. Great movie and a worthy successor to the original. ****","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":33928,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2001-04-11","keywords":"enforcer,movie flop,cigarette,body lands on a car,character repeats someone else's dialogue","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Get Carter","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi550306585","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGFlZGQ2MTQtNDMwMS00YjFiLTk3OWItZWI1YzBhZjRmMzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGFlZGQ2MTQtNDMwMS00YjFiLTk3OWItZWI1YzBhZjRmMzk2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Warner Home Video"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000230/","name":"Sylvester Stallone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000337/","name":"Rachael Leigh Cook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001669/","name":"Miranda Richardson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0443181/","name":"Stephen Kay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0043393/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052111/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0507794/","name":"Ted Lewis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571346/","name":"David McKenna"}],"duration":"PT1H42M"}</script><metacontent="

The Good Thief
programme.desc: The Good Thief: Directed by Neil Jordan. With Nutsa Kukhianidze, Ouassini Embarek, Tchéky Karyo, Marc Lavoine. An aging gambler on a losing streak attempts to rob a casino in Monte Carlo. But someone's already tipped off the cops before he even makes a move." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0281820/","name":"The Good Thief","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY2NDUyNDM5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwODEzNTk5._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging gambler on a losing streak attempts to rob a casino in Monte Carlo. But someone's already tipped off the cops before he even makes a move.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0281820/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dromasca"},"dateCreated":"2003-09-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stylish and Satisfying","reviewBody":"'The Good Thief' is the best film Neil Jordan did since 'Mona Lisa' almost two decades ago. It is a classical and well written robbery story, complex enough to catch the interest, simple enough for the spectator to follow and enjoy, and with the special twist at the end that makes a good script. The main character fits Nick Nolte like life, I can imagine only Humphrey Bogart doing better in this role. There are a few other memorable characters, with the Georgian (from the other Georgia) Nutza Kukhianidze promising to become soon a star if she has enough luck to continue to work with good directors and scripts. The cinematography has a special quality, with final stills after each shot, enhancing a good digital camera work. I also liked the soundtrack, it's a mix of classic, jazz and even Leonard Cohen sounds right for a change. 8/10 on my personal scale - certainly worth seeing.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":10380,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-02-28","keywords":"heist,casino,gambler,monte carlo,voyeur","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Good Thief","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi401801497","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjY0ZTNlZTItNWE5OS00NTZhLWExMzEtNGM2YThlYjBjZjY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjY0ZTNlZTItNWE5OS00NTZhLWExMzEtNGM2YThlYjBjZjY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000560/","name":"Nick Nolte"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000146/","name":"Ralph Fiennes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0474333/","name":"Nutsa Kukhianidze"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001403/","name":"Neil Jordan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103900/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0494138/","name":"Auguste Le Breton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578483/","name":"Jean-Pierre Melville"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001403/","name":"Neil Jordan"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="
