programme.title: Dark Horse
Czarny koń
Dark Horse
programme.desc: Dark Horse: Directed by Todd Solondz. With Melisa Young, Jordan Gelber, Selma Blair, Mia Farrow. Romance blooms between two tricenarians in arrested development: an avid toy collector who is the dark horse of his family and a depressed woman on the rebound." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1690455/","name":"Dark Horse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI5MDNjMDgtYjRlNy00ZGEyLWI3OTItZWIxYTcyY2FhNGU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two tricenarians in arrested development: an avid toy collector who is the dark horse of his family and a depressed woman on the rebound.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1690455/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MOscarbradley"},"dateCreated":"2013-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny peculiar rather than funny ha-ha!","reviewBody":"Todd Solondz obviously doesn't like people. If he did he wouldn't give us characters as thoroughly unlikable as Abe and Miranda, make them the leads in his disquieting, fantasy 'rom-com' "Dark Horse" and then set them up for our ridicule, (the 'comedy' comes from how much we laugh at these characters rather than with them). Abe is fat, unattractive and obnoxious with it and Jordan Gelber plays him superbly. Miranda is a would-be beauty who has let herself go; let herself go to the extent that she is prepared to marry Abe, a man she doesn't even like let alone love. Selma Blair plays her as a one-dimensional loser making her equally difficult to like. Abe lives at home with his parents, (brilliant performances from Christopher Walken and Mia Farrow), and works for his dad, though to be honest he doesn't do much work.\n\nThis is typical Solondz; a miserablist, myopic vision of humanity but without the brilliance that distinguished earlier pictures like "Welcome to the Dollhouse" and "Happiness". If I describe this as a 'pathetic' picture I don't mean that it's bad. It's very well written, directed and acted, (Donna Murphy is terrific as the secretary who fuels Abe's fantasies), but it's full of people you would cross town, never mind the street, to avoid and whatever handicaps you might have yourself it makes you glad you're not like anyone up there on the screen.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-29","keywords":"hepatitis b,man wrapped in a towel,collectible,theater poster,poster","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi516268569","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two thirty-somethings in arrested development: an avid toy collector who lives with his parents and a woman who is the dark horse of her family. IMDb data; ttnr: 1690455, Title: Dark Horse, --- Description: Dark Horse: Directed by Todd Solondz. With Melisa Young, Jordan Gelber, Selma Blair, Mia Farrow. Romance blooms between two tricenarians in arrested development: an avid toy collector who is the dark horse of his family and a depressed woman on the rebound." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1690455/","name":"Dark Horse","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjI5MDNjMDgtYjRlNy00ZGEyLWI3OTItZWIxYTcyY2FhNGU2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxMTY0OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two tricenarians in arrested development: an avid toy collector who is the dark horse of his family and a depressed woman on the rebound.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1690455/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"MOscarbradley","dateCreated":"2013-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Funny peculiar rather than funny ha-ha!","reviewBody":"Todd Solondz obviously doesn't like people. If he did he wouldn't give us characters as thoroughly unlikable as Abe and Miranda, make them the leads in his disquieting, fantasy 'rom-com' "Dark Horse" and then set them up for our ridicule, (the 'comedy' comes from how much we laugh at these characters rather than with them). Abe is fat, unattractive and obnoxious with it and Jordan Gelber plays him superbly. Miranda is a would-be beauty who has let herself go; let herself go to the extent that she is prepared to marry Abe, a man she doesn't even like let alone love. Selma Blair plays her as a one-dimensional loser making her equally difficult to like. Abe lives at home with his parents, (brilliant performances from Christopher Walken and Mia Farrow), and works for his dad, though to be honest he doesn't do much work.\n\nThis is typical Solondz; a miserablist, myopic vision of humanity but without the brilliance that distinguished earlier pictures like "Welcome to the Dollhouse" and "Happiness". If I describe this as a 'pathetic' picture I don't mean that it's bad. It's very well written, directed and acted, (Donna Murphy is terrific as the secretary who fuels Abe's fantasies), but it's full of people you would cross town, never mind the street, to avoid and whatever handicaps you might have yourself it makes you glad you're not like anyone up there on the screen.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":5933,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.9,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-29","keywords":"hepatitis b,man wrapped in a towel,collectible,theater poster,poster","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi516268569","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTkyNjU2MTgxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDgwMTcyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romance blooms between two thirty-somethings in arrested development: an avid toy collector who lives with his parents and a woman who is the dark horse of her family. ","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0312217/","name":"Jordan Gelber","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004757/","name":"Selma Blair","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000686/","name":"Christopher Walken"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001754/","name":"Todd Solondz"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0316179/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001754/","name":"Todd Solondz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0543283/","name":"Harold Manning"],"duration":"PT1H26M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Almighty Thor
Thor wszechmogący
Almighty Thor
programme.desc:
Almighty Thor: Directed by Christopher Ray. With Cody Deal, Richard Grieco, Patricia Velasquez, Kevin Nash. When a demon god steals the Hammer of Invincibility, Thor strikes a mighty blow to get it back." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1792794/","name":"Almighty Thor","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwNjI5MTAzNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTcyOTIwNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a demon god steals the Hammer of Invincibility, Thor strikes a mighty blow to get it back.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1792794/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chsuth"},"dateCreated":"2011-05-07","inLanguage":"English","name":"Crackers and cheese, the soft, smelly kind","reviewBody":"I have read other reviews of this film, and think they are being generous to talk about this film as having five characters, because I saw some people wandering around on the screen, sometimes in slo-mo, other times in no-mo, but there wasn't much character there. Cody Deal, who is he, by the way?, has the body for Thor; too bad they kept it covered up most of the time with a Wal-Mart quality costume. He doesn't have the voice for this kind of hero, however, and I kept waiting for him to just stop talking.

Richard Grieco has acting skills, which unfortunately he left back in the 1980s and neglected to bring along to this film. The rest can go without mention.

As for the plot, well, it is hard to talk about plot here. Thor is supposed to save the world by defeating the evil devil-god Loki in the back alleys of Los Angeles, and every other low-budget location that could be had for a hundred bucks and some coffee-shop coupons. Round this out with computer animations and enhancements straight off of my old Commodore 64 computer, and you get a major horror film, but perhaps not the kind of horror really intended. Someone was channeling Ed Wood here for sure. We just needed burning paper plates doubling as UFOs to complete the effect, and hey, there's an idea for a sequel! Syfy and Asylum were looking to cash in on the bigger Thor picture in theaters now (apparently this Thor auditioned for that role, too; in what universe was that going to happen?) but apparently Brannagh's Thor isn't hammering the crowds, either, in real blockbuster fashion.

Well, I guess this is the season for Worse rather than Norse.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2842,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":1.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2011-05-07","keywords":"marvel comics,demon,hammer,violence,fan film","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Almighty Thor","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2770189337","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2UxMmQ0M2QtZjRlYS00OTYxLWE4YWUtY2JlNTBmMzMwYzYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2UxMmQ0M2QtZjRlYS00OTYxLWE4YWUtY2JlNTBmMzMwYzYxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3382024/","name":"Cody Deal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001298/","name":"Richard Grieco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0892383/","name":"Patricia Velasquez"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0712782/","name":"Christopher Ray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042909/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0286790/","name":"Eric Forsberg"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Exorcist: The Beginning
Egzorcysta: Początek
Exorcist: The Beginning
programme.desc:
Exorcist: The Beginning: Directed by Renny Harlin. With Stellan Skarsgård, Izabella Scorupco, James D'Arcy, Remy Sweeney. Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0204313/","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI0NzY1MzQ0MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTM1MTEzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Years before Father Lankester Merrin helped save Regan MacNeil's soul, he first encounters the demon Pazuzu in East Africa. This is the tale of Father Merrin's initial battle with Pazuzu and the rediscovery of his faith.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0204313/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"orven84"},"dateCreated":"2006-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"The Beginning over Dominion? Definitely","reviewBody":"First, let me say that I didn't know Dominion existed until I discovered it going through the program guide. I started watching and man was I confused! I though that there was ANOTHER prequel that I didn't know about, until I continued to watch. Dominion seemed to me like a movie made out of pieces of film on the floor of the editing room. Clara Bellar's acting was awful in my opinion. I was completely distracted by her performance as well as several others.

While not a true horror movie, I really enjoyed The Beginning. I've watched it many times and found it very suspenseful. It kept my attention. I enjoyed the actors and the story. I've watched it over ten times and the scenes where Father M had to choose those to die? Chilling. Who wouldn't lose faith? The boy being torn apart? There were some good scenes.

Peace","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36272,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Mystery","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2005-02-09","keywords":"lucifer morningstar character,supernatural horror,psychotronic film,cgi animal in live action title,movie flop","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Exorcist: The Beginning","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3262429721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGNmNTMyZGMtNGI1My00OWRjLWE1ZGEtNDU5YmE1ZGFkYjBlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001745/","name":"Stellan Skarsgård"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001713/","name":"Izabella Scorupco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0195439/","name":"James D'Arcy"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001317/","name":"Renny Harlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033472/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0067503/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0527643/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0087861/","name":"William Peter Blatty"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936537/","name":"William Wisher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139627/","name":"Caleb Carr"}],"duration":"PT1H54M"}</script><metacontent="

Definitely","reviewBody":"First, let me say that I didn't know Dominion existed until I discovered it going through the program guide. I started watching and man was I confused! I though that there was ANOTHER prequel that I didn't know about, until I continued to watch. Dominion seemed to me like a movie made out of pieces of film on the floor of the editing room. Clara Bellar's acting was awful in my opinion. I was completely distracted by her performance as well as several others.

While not a true horror movie, I really enjoyed The Beginning. I've watched it many times and found it very suspenseful. It kept my attention. I enjoyed the actors and the story. I've watched it over ten times and the scenes where Father M had to choose those to die? Chilling. Who wouldn't lose faith? The boy being torn apart? There were some good scenes.

programme.title: Anaconda: Offspring
Anakonda 3: Potomstwo
Anaconda III
programme.desc:
Anaconda: Offspring: Directed by Don E. FauntLeRoy. With David Hasselhoff, Crystal Allen, Ryan McCluskey, Patrick Regis. A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1137996/","name":"Anaconda: Offspring","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGY5MDI5Y2ItNDk2MS00NzJlLWJmMTEtNGYwM2Y4ZjU2MjIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1137996/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"player_pawn"},"dateCreated":"2008-09-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Where's the Hoff?","reviewBody":"When a film features David Hasselhoff and his crack team of snake-fighting mercenaries facing off against a 60-foot-long genetically altered anaconda before the opening credits even roll, any fan of B-movie cheese can arguably presume they're in for a good time. Hasselhoff's self-deprecating humor and strange otherworldly charm make him an endearing punchline, and also translates well into the world of Sci Fi Channel stardom. Sadly, after that opening scene, The Hoff all but disappears for the next 45 minutes of the film, and what starts with campy reptile-killin' fun quickly spirals into boring laboratory diatribes about the dangers of gene manipulation and the real-world uses of unlikely immortality drugs.

Although the ads would lead one to believe otherwise, ANACONDA III actually centers on Amanda (Crystal Allen), a scientist who works for Universal Bio-Tech and the nefariousand appropriately namedMurdoch (John Rhys-Davies, obviously still fuming over not being included in the new Indiana Jones film). It seems that he's been playing God with the reptilian world and has somehow managed to create an anaconda that's not only larger and angrier than any snake on Earth, but sports a three-foot machete growing out of its tail. This Ginsu butt comes into play numerous times during the film, and while the results are always spectacularly gory, a serpent's bladed posterior is inescapably difficult to take seriously.

Since all B-movie snakes carry the cure for (insert disease here), another round of unethical testing is underway, and it isn't long before our slithering behemoth breaks out of its cage, knocks off everyone but Amanda and her boss and heads out into the lush green wilderness of Romania. It's only then that Hasselhoff's Hammett and a group of ALIENS space-Marine rejects (resembling the United Colors of Benetton) are hired to eradicate the monster, which has taken up residence in a nearby farmhouse. With that, we've now got the prerequisite team of Special Ops, the cheap sets and the giant CG monster everything required for a yet another weak entry in the recent string of bland Sci Fi Channel originals.

Director Don E. FauntLeroy, who served as DP on the JEEPERS CREEPERS movies and nearly 50 other films, has managed to shoot a good-looking feature, but fills it with every painful cliché imaginable. First-time screenwriters Nicholas Davidoff and David Olson sprinkle in occasionally fun dialogue, but their script is ultimately burdened down with bland characters and extremely corny, uninspired plot twists. Hasselhoff's Hammett, a fun antihero who deserves more screen time (and one-liners), is delegated to a glorified supporting role beneath far less interesting characters. Rhys-Davies, whose cameo appearances work quite well, will hopefully receive a beefier role in ANACONDA IV (the direct sequel shot back to back with this movie, scheduled to debut this December); otherwise, he served virtually no purpose at all. It's only Allen as the spunky Amanda who breathes any life into her role; a surprise, given her lack of substantial film experience prior to headlining this one. Unfortunately, given the material, even she has trouble rising above the movie's stupendous mediocrity. When all is said and done, ANACONDA III should have been a much better film, but it also could have been much worse. The cast is sorely mismanaged, the plot is all over the board and the digital FXparticularly a handful of atrocious greenscreen driving shotsare by-and-large laughable, but the cast and crew obviously worked hard with what little they had. With any luck, this sequel's surviving characters will find more to do in the next entry, and we'll end up with a film that's not just meatier, but more entertaining. A direct-to-cable second follow-up to a creature feature headlined by J. Lo and Ice Cube doesn't need to be a masterpiece, but it should be passable as an evening's fleeting distraction. ANACONDA III is just barely that, but it's still regrettable that something as inherently amusing as David Hasselhoff fighting a giant snake couldn't have ended up just the slightest bit more fun.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7736,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Horror"],"datePublished":"2008-07-26","keywords":"anaconda,snakeskin,psychotronic film,woman wears a gas mask,snake","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Anaconda III: Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2085683225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MDk2NDQ2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzI0OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MDk2NDQ2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzI0OTYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mercenary-for-hire accepts a mission from a billionaire to capture a dangerous snake that could possibly help cure a terminal illness."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001327/","name":"David Hasselhoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1296597/","name":"Crystal Allen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1011675/","name":"Ryan McCluskey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005703/","name":"Don E. FauntLeRoy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0020879/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186146/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1682328/","name":"Nicholas Davidoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2837937/","name":"David C. Olson"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Mimic
Mutant
Mimic
programme.desc:
Mimic: Directed by Guillermo del Toro. With Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam, Alexander Goodwin, Giancarlo Giannini. Three years ago, entomologist Dr. Susan Tyler genetically created an insect to kill cockroaches carrying a virulent disease. Now, the insects are out to destroy their only predator, mankind." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119675/","name":"Mimic","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODk4MjRkODctOTVjNS00MmI2LTg0Y2ItMWQyMzdkZDU3MzMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three years ago, entomologist Dr. Susan Tyler genetically created an insect to kill cockroaches carrying a virulent disease. Now, the insects are out to destroy their only predator, mankind.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119675/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"bob the moo"},"dateCreated":"2002-01-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark and atmospheric horror","reviewBody":"In New York a disease carried by cockroaches threatens to wipe out a whole generation of children. A scientist, Susan Tyler, breeds a new bug that mimics the cockroach and wipes out the disease. However years later something is living in New York's subways that looks human. Tyler suspects that her breed has not died out but has evolved to imitate it's natural predator - us. Her investigations into the subway lead her to more than she bargained for.

This is an atmospheric thriller from Guillermo del Toro, director of The Devil's Backbone and Cronos. He manages to mix great director with good old fashioned monster horror to great effect. The concept itself is clever, even if the idea of bugs evolving to look very like humans is a little far fetched. However, once the action moves to the subway the fact that the bugs are clearly lethal no matter what they look like, makes this less important. The film is quite short and makes the action come quicker and seem more urgent. Several people get killed by the bug that wouldn't usually get killed in this sort of horror (children for example), this is very effective as it is quite scary to see the unexpected happen.

The mood is dark throughout and Del Toro uses the sewers and subway to great effect, creating a real sense of claustrophobia - like the humans have entered the bug's world and not the other way round. The bugs are shown early on in the film - usually not a good idea (keep it hidden in the Jaws way), but here the special effects are good enough to make the bug really believable. However the horror is not in seeing the bugs but in they way they hunt and kill - the fear is in what could happen. That's why seeing them doesn't take anything away.

The cast are great, Sorvino especially is very good in the lead. Jeremy Northam and Charles S. Dutton are good in support and Abraham Murray adds a bit of cameo class (though his role is quite unnecessary). But the director is the real star adding some genuine scares and real mood to a film that could have easily been just another creature-feature that goes straight to video and straight to the back of your mind.

Overall a superior creature horror film."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":48689,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1997-08-22","keywords":"giant insect,insect,disease,entomologist,cockroach","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Mimic","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3387923993","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmMyYmE4YzktNWMwMy00NmVkLThiMDQtYTU0Yzc4OTc1N2IyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmMyYmE4YzktNWMwMy00NmVkLThiMDQtYTU0Yzc4OTc1N2IyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000227/","name":"Mira Sorvino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000562/","name":"Jeremy Northam"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0329422/","name":"Alexander Goodwin"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0938586/","name":"Donald A. IMDb data; ttnr: 0119675, Title: Mimic, --- Description: Mimic: Directed by Guillermo del Toro. With Mira Sorvino, Jeremy Northam, Alexander Goodwin, Giancarlo Giannini. Three years ago, entomologist Dr. Susan Tyler genetically created an insect to kill cockroaches carrying a virulent disease. Now, the insects are out to destroy their only predator, mankind." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0119675/","name":"Mimic","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODk4MjRkODctOTVjNS00MmI2LTg0Y2ItMWQyMzdkZDU3MzMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Three years ago, entomologist Dr. Susan Tyler genetically created an insect to kill cockroaches carrying a virulent disease. Now, the insects are out to destroy their only predator, mankind.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0119675/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"bob the moo","dateCreated":"2002-01-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dark and atmospheric horror","reviewBody":"In New York a disease carried by cockroaches threatens to wipe out a whole generation of children. A scientist, Susan Tyler, breeds a new bug that mimics the cockroach and wipes out the disease. However years later something is living in New York's subways that looks human. Tyler suspects that her breed has not died out but has evolved to imitate it's natural predator - us. Her investigations into the subway lead her to more than she bargained for.

This is an atmospheric thriller from Guillermo del Toro, director of The Devil's Backbone and Cronos. He manages to mix great director with good old fashioned monster horror to great effect. The concept itself is clever, even if the idea of bugs evolving to look very like humans is a little far fetched. However, once the action moves to the subway the fact that the bugs are clearly lethal no matter what they look like, makes this less important. The film is quite short and makes the action come quicker and seem more urgent. Several people get killed by the bug that wouldn't usually get killed in this sort of horror (children for example), this is very effective as it is quite scary to see the unexpected happen.

The mood is dark throughout and Del Toro uses the sewers and subway to great effect, creating a real sense of claustrophobia - like the humans have entered the bug's world and not the other way round. The bugs are shown early on in the film - usually not a good idea (keep it hidden in the Jaws way), but here the special effects are good enough to make the bug really believable. However the horror is not in seeing the bugs but in they way they hunt and kill - the fear is in what could happen. That's why seeing them doesn't take anything away.

The cast are great, Sorvino especially is very good in the lead. Jeremy Northam and Charles S. Dutton are good in support and Abraham Murray adds a bit of cameo class (though his role is quite unnecessary). But the director is the real star adding some genuine scares and real mood to a film that could have easily been just another creature-feature that goes straight to video and straight to the back of your mind.

Overall a superior creature horror film.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":48689,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"1997-08-22","keywords":"giant insect,insect,disease,entomologist,cockroach","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Mimic","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3387923993","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmMyYmE4YzktNWMwMy00NmVkLThiMDQtYTU0Yzc4OTc1N2IyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmMyYmE4YzktNWMwMy00NmVkLThiMDQtYTU0Yzc4OTc1N2IyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000227/","name":"Mira Sorvino","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000562/","name":"Jeremy Northam","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0329422/","name":"Alexander Goodwin"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0868219/","name":"Guillermo del Toro"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019626/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022594/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0938586/","name":"Donald A. Darkness Falls
programme.desc:
Darkness Falls: Directed by Jonathan Liebesman. With Chaney Kley, Emma Caulfield Ford, Lee Cormie, Grant Piro. A vengeful spirit has taken the form of the Tooth Fairy to exact vengeance on the town that lynched her 150 years earlier. Her only opposition is the only child, now grown up, who has survived her before." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0282209/","name":"Darkness Falls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjcwOGM4ZDUtOGFiZS00YTAxLWExMTQtMWQ1NGU2NTZjYjg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A vengeful spirit has taken the form of the Tooth Fairy to exact vengeance on the town that lynched her 150 years earlier. Her only opposition is the only child, now grown up, who has survived her before.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0282209/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LessThanPaddy"},"dateCreated":"2017-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Severe nightmares once upon a time...","reviewBody":"Okay, I admit this may not be a great movie, but I don't think it is the worst either. However, I do think I'm only saying that because I loved it as a kid. Honestly, it was always the choice of scary film for me and my friends at sleepovers etc. It was scary, the tooth-fairy character is my idea of a worst nightmare, and believe me she gave me plenty in the years that followed. I haven't seen it in a few years and while it may not haunt me anymore I suspect it would give me an intermediate shiver if I watched it again today.

Usually I bash films like this. There are probably better horror films out there that I've given worse reviews too, but this one holds sentimental value for me and I genuinely believe that it's not THAT bad. The acting isn't wonderful and the story plays out a bit predictably... I still quite like the premise though and the legend behind Matilda the tooth-fairy.

If you scare easily, I wouldn't recommend you watch this alone. The movie might not be top, but it is full of jumps and the villain is horrifying. Enjoy (with the lights on).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Fantasy","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2003-05-21","keywords":"tooth fairy,darkness,night terrors,fear of the dark,supernatural horror","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Darkness Falls","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3634364697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0YTA0YzEtZTcyMS00YmI2LTkyZDEtNzg0MWYxZmUyZmJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0YTA0YzEtZTcyMS00YmI2LTkyZDEtNzg0MWYxZmUyZmJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Sony Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1015096/","name":"Chaney Kley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146536/","name":"Emma Caulfield Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1112328/","name":"Antony Burrows"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0509448/","name":"Jonathan Liebesman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022564/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364899/","name":"Joe Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004591/","name":"John Fasano"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0888743/","name":"James Vanderbilt"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

The defiant leader Moses rises up against Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses II, setting six hundred thousand slaves on a monumental journey of escape from Egypt and its terrifying cycle of deadly plagues." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1528100/","name":"Exodus: Gods and Kings","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI3MDY0NjkxNl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTM3NTA0MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The defiant leader Moses rises up against Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses II, setting six hundred thousand slaves on a monumental journey of escape from Egypt and its terrifying cycle of deadly plagues.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1528100/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"harrypaulson-111"},"dateCreated":"2014-12-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Christian humble?","reviewBody":"Let me say immediately. Visually, technically, this film is a wonder and for that alone it deserves to be seen but then. Oh brother. Christian Bale, one of my favorites among the post-De Niro crop, is cast as Moses, you know? Moses - the man chosen by God for his humbleness. Christian's Moses blazes with self confidence. The Godly horrors known as plagues are a cinematic jaw dropping experience but when it returns to the actual drama. Oh brother. How can it possibly be? When the great Ridley Scott made his Robin Hood (did you see it?)his star Russell Crowe went to a talk show to promote the movie and called the Erroll Flynn version, "crap" - You see? I think that's at the center of the problem.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":164450,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"contentRating":"(Banned)","genre":["Action","Adventure","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-12-31","keywords":"moses,pharaoh,plague,egypt,exodus","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1381084953","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMjc2OTc5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk3OTU1MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUwMjc2OTc5NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTk3OTU1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The defiant leader Moses rises up against the Egyptian Pharaoh Ramses, setting 600,000 slaves on a monumental journey of escape from Egypt and its terrifying cycle of deadly plagues.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000288/","name":"Christian Bale"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0249291/","name":"Joel Edgerton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001426/","name":"Ben Kingsley"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000631/","name":"Ridley Scott"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0286257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074212/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0454147/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0177836/","name":"Adam Cooper"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0171651/","name":"Bill Collage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0128997/","name":"Jeffrey Caine"}],"duration":"PT2H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Serbuan maut 2: Berandal
The Raid 2: Infiltracja
Serbuan maut 2: Berandal
programme.desc:
Serbuan maut 2: Berandal: Directed by Gareth Evans. With Iko Uwais, Arifin Putra, Tio Pakusadewo, Oka Antara. Only a short time after the first raid, Rama goes undercover with the thugs of Jakarta and plans to bring down the syndicate and uncover the corruption within his police force." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2265171/","name":"Serbuan maut 2: Berandal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5MTE2NjA4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTUyMjczMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Only a short time after the first raid, Rama goes undercover with the thugs of Jakarta and plans to bring down the syndicate and uncover the corruption within his police force.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2265171/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"hugo-armstrong"},"dateCreated":"2014-03-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Excellent Sequel and Fantastic Action / Martial Arts Movie","reviewBody":"The first movie 'The Raid: Redemption' set the bar for action movies. With its fast paced action and believable fight scene choreography whilst not being over the top with an aim for realism that would diminish the combat's entertainment factor.

With 'The Raid 2: Berandal', we are brought back into the gritty world of the first movie directly following where the story left off. The viewers are introduced to an entirely new perspective on the world where the first movie is set. In the first movie we are locked in the one perspective of Rama and his battle through the building, whilst in the sequel we learn that this all takes place as part of a much larger setting. We find out that realism is not the aim of the series and instead its a world of gangsters, villains and corruption.

Evans is able to introduce new characters like the 'Hammer Girl' and the 'Baseball Bat' guy without making them seem totally over the top and ridiculous. We also get to watch them fight and are able to enjoy their unique styles rather than the usual, 'this character is a bad guy' scenes to barely introduce them.

The fight scenes are excellently choreographed and the way they are shot is spectacular, a lot of imagination and ingenuity is used to really throw the viewer directly into the action. The gore and violence level reflect far more realistic outcomes considering the brutality of both the scenarios and the weapons.

IMDb data; ttnr: 2265171, Title: Serbuan maut 2: Berandal, --- Description: Serbuan maut 2: Berandal: Directed by Gareth Evans. With Iko Uwais, Arifin Putra, Tio Pakusadewo, Oka Antara. Only a short time after the first raid, Rama goes undercover with the thugs of Jakarta and plans to bring down the syndicate and uncover the corruption within his police force." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2265171/","name":"Serbuan maut 2: Berandal","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg5MTE2NjA4OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTUyMjczMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Only a short time after the first raid, Rama goes undercover with the thugs of Jakarta and plans to bring down the syndicate and uncover the corruption within his police force.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2265171/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"hugo-armstrong","dateCreated":"2014-03-29","inLanguage":"English","name":"An Excellent Sequel and Fantastic Action / Martial Arts Movie","reviewBody":"The first movie 'The Raid: Redemption' set the bar for action movies. With its fast paced action and believable fight scene choreography whilst not being over the top with an aim for realism that would diminish the combat's entertainment factor.

With 'The Raid 2: Berandal', we are brought back into the gritty world of the first movie directly following where the story left off. The viewers are introduced to an entirely new perspective on the world where the first movie is set. In the first movie we are locked in the one perspective of Rama and his battle through the building, whilst in the sequel we learn that this all takes place as part of a much larger setting. We find out that realism is not the aim of the series and instead its a world of gangsters, villains and corruption.

Evans is able to introduce new characters like the 'Hammer Girl' and the 'Baseball Bat' guy without making them seem totally over the top and ridiculous. We also get to watch them fight and are able to enjoy their unique styles rather than the usual, 'this character is a bad guy' scenes to barely introduce them.

The fight scenes are excellently choreographed and the way they are shot is spectacular, a lot of imagination and ingenuity is used to really throw the viewer directly into the action. The gore and violence level reflect far more realistic outcomes considering the brutality of both the scenarios and the weapons.

When I try to compare this to the usual Hollywood blockbuster action movies reduced to PG13 to get more people in to watch it, its impossible. The movie delivers far more in the way of action and fight sequences whilst maintaining a sensible and cohesive plot.

If you are expecting(for some bizarre reason) to see an amazing plot to compare to The Godfather or The Departed you probably are expecting the wrong things. If you are expecting to see a amazing fighting / martial arts movie with a believable plot you wont be disappointed. The movie reminded me a little of a Tarantino film with its characters, something like Kill Bill. But instead with way way way better fight scenes and frankly, a better plot as well.

Overall considering where this movie is from and the cast involved etc any negative rating is totally undeserved. Whilst not everyone's cup of tea as far as martial arts / action movies go this movie will be impossible to top in 2014, and frankly its probably the best action movie I have seen in the last decade, it will be on the top of my list for a while.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":119293,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2014-04-11","keywords":"violence,prison,jakarta indonesia,kitchen fight,corrupt police officer","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi530950937","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMDk5Mzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ4NjMyMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyMDk5Mzg1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTQ4NjMyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Immediately following the events of the original, Officer Rama is pressured to join an anti-corruption task force to guarantee protection for his wife and child. His mission is to get close to a new mob boss, Bangun, by befriending his incarcerated son, Uco. Rama must hunt for information linking Bangun with corruption in the Jakarta Police Department while pursuing a dangerous and personal vendetta that threatens to consume him and bring his mission -- and the organized crime syndicate -- down around him.
","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3299397/","name":"Iko Uwais","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3345670/","name":"Yayan Ruhian","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3022653/","name":"Arifin Putra"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2153088/","name":"Gareth Evans"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014453/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0261531/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2153088/","name":"Gareth Evans"],"duration":"PT2H30M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Binhi
Binhi
programme.desc: Binhi: Directed by Pedring Lopez. With Roxanne Barcelo, Cholo Barretto, Joem Bascon, Akihiro Blanco. Daniel and Cynthia, a young couple with a child on the way, experience some hard times in Manila. They head back to Baguio, where Daniel is originally from, to start over again. Through the kindness of Alex, Daniel's well-to-do childhood friend, they get to stay in a large house, rent-free; and he gets a job offer as well. The worst seems to be over for them. Or so they think. Funny things start to happen in their nice house. It starts out as movements caught on the periphery, whispered sounds, unexplained feelings. It's seems that the house in haunted. The ghost is a child. A little girl. The spirit manifests in the house and follows the occupants around. Daniel, whose past is a mystery to his wife, has been running away from something or someone in Baguio. He's starting to realize that what he has been running away from is starting to haunt him. As the story progresses, the subtle manifestations become full-blown apparitions. The film culminates in a series of flashbacks experience by Daniel - celebrating his recent graduation, partying and getting drunk in the process, driving under the influence, causing a deadly car accident with a mother and child, the mother seemingly dying, the little girl with faint signs of life, Daniel taking her to the hospital, the child seemingly dying in his arms, the moral dilemma Daniel goes through, his "Faustus" moment, his decision to bury the child in a remote, shallow grave, the child being buried alive! It is revealed that the little girl who Daniel buried alive is the ghost haunting them and the house that they're staying in was her family's!" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4678058/","name":"Binhi","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzAwNmI3OTItMjEzNi00YTMyLThhOGMtYzg3ODM0ZDMxNDMyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI5NjIyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Daniel and Cynthia, a young couple with a child on the way, experience some hard times in Manila. They head back to Baguio, where Daniel is originally from, to start over again. programme.title: A Thousand Kisses Deep
Tysiąc pocałunków w głąb
A Thousand Kisses Deep
programme.desc:
A Thousand Kisses Deep: Directed by Dana Lustig. With Emilia Fox, Jodie Whittaker, David Warner, Dougray Scott. An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1565069/","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMDQzNDA5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDQyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1565069/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rooprect"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"They always fall for the trumpet player","reviewBody":"In case you're wondering, yes, "A Thousand Kisses Deep" takes its name as well as its somber mood from the 2001 Leonard Cohen song "A Thousand Kisses Deep". But for Cohen fans, I don't remember hearing the song in the film, only the lyrics spoken at the beginning and end. So, much like the movie "Starman" which does not have the Bowie song, it's a bit of a bummer.

If you can get past that, no problem.

The film itself is like a blend of "The Lake House", "The Time Traveler's Wife" and "Sleeping with the Enemy" with maybe a dash of "Angel Heart" with its sexuality and diabolical symbolism. It takes a deliberately fragmented, psueudo-supernatural approach, challenging the viewer like in "The Lake House". It features a character traveling through time like in "The Time Traveler's Wife", and it revolves around a quietly abusive relationship between a man & a woman like in "Sleeping with the Enemy". Throw them all together and mix vigorously with a dash of very nice jazz trumpet music, and there you have "A Thousand Kisses Deep".

It is NOT a "science fiction" as I've read in some places (why do people see "time travel" and immediately think HG Welles and Star Trek??). And it's definitely not a "romance", unless your idea of romance includes borderline rape, borderline paedophilia and something even worse which I won't ruin for you. It's not a straightforward thriller because there's not really any terror. So this film is pretty hard to classify except to say that it's the story of a woman who is trying to fix her past, present and future before it ends in disaster.

By the way, although I just threw a bunch of spooky themes at you (rape, paedophilia, etc), don't worry because the film is not explicit or graphic in any way. It implies a lot of things, but I don't think there's any nudity other than Jodie Whittaker's backside shown through a closet door. This subtle style of filmmaking is prevalent in the whole movie, which means there aren't a lot of melodramatic clichés or people shouting & breaking things. What's funny is that the *lack* of action/violence makes the film even more sinister to me.

Another interesting spin is the way the story is very dreamlike--symbolic and metaphoric rather than realistic--so you don't get caught up analyzing plot details. For example, the time traveler is never recognized by any of the other characters even though you'd think they would. Also, settings don't change either, and although some characters age expectedly, others stay the same. It sets an interesting tone, as if telling us (like a dream) that certain appearances are not as important as their meaning.

This is director Dana Lustig's latest film credit (as of 2014), and I hope there are many more to come. It is one of the rare thrillers with a female perspective which I (a guy) find so much more provocative than the standard Hollywood thrillers about some dude who's steamrolling through the story trying to be cool. "A Thousand Kisses Deep" has just enough enough pauses for reflection while maintaining its momentum. Definitely give this a whirl if you're looking for a movie that's pensive yet provocative and certainly different from all the rest.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Romance","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2012-06-15","keywords":"four word title,title directed by female,written by director,female protagonist,abusive boyfriend","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1763615513","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for A Thousand Kisses Deep"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0288976/","name":"Emilia Fox"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2092886/","name":"Jodie Whittaker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001831/","name":"David Warner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527325/","name":"Dana Lustig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0293122/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0476384/","name":"Alex Kustanovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3730130/","name":"Vadim Moldovan"}],"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1565069/","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkxMDQzNDA5Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjEwMDQyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An unsettling drama that cinematically captures and recreates the psycho-analytic experience.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1565069/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"rooprect","dateCreated":"2014-04-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"They always fall for the trumpet player","reviewBody":"In case you're wondering, yes, "A Thousand Kisses Deep" takes its name as well as its somber mood from the 2001 Leonard Cohen song "A Thousand Kisses Deep". But for Cohen fans, I don't remember hearing the song in the film, only the lyrics spoken at the beginning and end. So, much like the movie "Starman" which does not have the Bowie song, it's a bit of a bummer.

If you can get past that, no problem.

The film itself is like a blend of "The Lake House", "The Time Traveler's Wife" and "Sleeping with the Enemy" with maybe a dash of "Angel Heart" with its sexuality and diabolical symbolism. It takes a deliberately fragmented, psueudo-supernatural approach, challenging the viewer like in "The Lake House". It features a character traveling through time like in "The Time Traveler's Wife", and it revolves around a quietly abusive relationship between a man & a woman like in "Sleeping with the Enemy". Throw them all together and mix vigorously with a dash of very nice jazz trumpet music, and there you have "A Thousand Kisses Deep".

It is NOT a "science fiction" as I've read in some places (why do people see "time travel" and immediately think HG Welles and Star Trek??). And it's definitely not a "romance", unless your idea of romance includes borderline rape, borderline paedophilia and something even worse which I won't ruin for you. It's not a straightforward thriller because there's not really any terror. So this film is pretty hard to classify except to say that it's the story of a woman who is trying to fix her past, present and future before it ends in disaster.

By the way, although I just threw a bunch of spooky themes at you (rape, paedophilia, etc), don't worry because the film is not explicit or graphic in any way. It implies a lot of things, but I don't think there's any nudity other than Jodie Whittaker's backside shown through a closet door. This subtle style of filmmaking is prevalent in the whole movie, which means there aren't a lot of melodramatic clichés or people shouting & breaking things. What's funny is that the *lack* of action/violence makes the film even more sinister to me.

Another interesting spin is the way the story is very dreamlike--symbolic and metaphoric rather than realistic--so you don't get caught up analyzing plot details. For example, the time traveler is never recognized by any of the other characters even though you'd think they would. Also, settings don't change either, and although some characters age expectedly, others stay the same. It sets an interesting tone, as if telling us (like a dream) that certain appearances are not as important as their meaning.

This is director Dana Lustig's latest film credit (as of 2014), and I hope there are many more to come. It is one of the rare thrillers with a female perspective which I (a guy) find so much more provocative than the standard Hollywood thrillers about some dude who's steamrolling through the story trying to be cool. "A Thousand Kisses Deep" has just enough enough pauses for reflection while maintaining its momentum. Definitely give this a whirl if you're looking for a movie that's pensive yet provocative and certainly different from all the rest.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":483,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.1,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Romance","Sci-Fi","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2012-06-15","keywords":"four word title,title directed by female,written by director,female protagonist,abusive boyfriend","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"A Thousand Kisses Deep","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1763615513","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlmODJlMmYtNDIzNi00OTcwLThjYzgtYTUxZDljZWQ3MTg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for A Thousand Kisses Deep","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0288976/","name":"Emilia Fox","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2092886/","name":"Jodie Whittaker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001831/","name":"David Warner"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0527325/","name":"Dana Lustig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0293122/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0476384/","name":"Alex Kustanovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3730130/","name":"Vadim Moldovan"],"duration":"PT1H24M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bone Eater
Zjadacz kości
Bone Eater
programme.desc:
Bone Eater: Directed by Jim Wynorski. With Bruce Boxleitner, Michael Horse, Adoni Maropis, Clara Bryant. Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0796306/","name":"Bone Eater","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjE2MjI4OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDU5MTk5MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Ancient Native American legend of the Bone Eater rises up and begins terrorizing the local townspeople.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0796306/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MartianOctocretr5"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Amusing, certainly not scary","reviewBody":"Another Indian legend you never heard of before is let loose. As the name implies, this is a vengeful wraith who likes to absorb the skeletons of people while they're still using them. As usual, ancient burial grounds (can you say, "Poltergeist?") have been disturbed by clichéd greedy land developers building stuff.

The CGI, if it had been better, might have made the effect more treacherous looking, but they skimped on the budget, and it shows--to comical effect. The unleashed creature probably should have been kept off stage during its first several killings-that might have added some mystery or impending doom atmosphere-but the inept director decided to show us in the first five minutes what it looks like, and it wasn't impressive. The deaths are just poorly done, again with shoddy CGI. I guess ancient spirits always kill by using cheap special effects. As for the "victims," they look they're going to laugh any moment while they do goofy screams. It's always obvious who's going to get it: a character with only a few lines shows up, strange noises are heard, CGI dots fly, exit character. Repeat (several times).

Still, there's a few chase scenes featuring the monster that actually made this thing watchable. Unfortunately, the director seems to be using these as a device to fall back on (so it's used too often) when he can't think of anything else for his characters to do. Overall, it's pretty silly, but I've seen worse. This flick is cheap, but it's oddly fun to watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1231,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":2.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2008-02-09","keywords":"evil skeleton monster,skeleton warrior,bone,worker,giant skeleton","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000310/","name":"Bruce Boxleitner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395398/","name":"Michael Horse"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0549538/","name":"Adoni Maropis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0691061/","name":"Jim Wynorski"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0486610/","name":"William Langlois"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jabberwock
Jabberwock - Przebudzenie bestii
Jabberwock
programme.desc:
Jabberwock: Directed by Steven R. Monroe. With Tahmoh Penikett, Kacey Clarke, Raffaello Degruttola, Michael Worth. A brave knight returns to his homeland to find a powerful dragon terrorizing his village. After many unsuccessful attempts to defeat the monster, he makes a sword which has magical powers that should do the trick." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1734203/","name":"Jabberwock","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1Mzk4NTk3MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDE5MTAyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A brave knight returns to his homeland to find a powerful dragon terrorizing his village. After many unsuccessful attempts to defeat the monster, he makes a sword which has magical powers that should do the trick.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1734203/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BornKnight"},"dateCreated":"2012-03-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stay away from the Jabberwock","reviewBody":"This movie is one of the many produced by the SyFy Channel: in general they are regular to bad (mostly) productions, in all senses, and Jabberwock is not an exception.

The movie is about two travelers, in the Medieval Age (aparently in our world, since they mention the Romans), and who traveling by the mountains, find a lake with some egg like stones - that are in fact eggs of Jabberwock.

One of the eggs hatch, in a rainstorm (in this area there wasn't rain for decades), and a dragon like creature, the Jabberwock, emerges, killing one of the travelers and starts pursuing the other, who ends up in a village, where we meet the other protagonists.

The rest of the story is the hunt to kill this creature, among other small clichés hooks of tragedy, heroism and romance.

The movie has nice scenarios, but the general acting in the movie is terrible, with no exception. The Jabberwock itself is made with CG, and is relatively acceptable.

The action and fighting parts of the movie are the worst: the camera shifts from views from the men branding swords, and the CG monster, like bad movies of the 60-70's, among many other incongruence in story and actions that occurs.

By the way, "Jabberwocky" is a poem from Lewis Caroll, that appears in the sequences of the book Alice in Wonderland - and many things are related to it in the film) - I don't know and don't want to know why they done this (in general all writers from Scy-Fy Channel are the worst writers that I've seen).

The sound effects and background music you don't even realize if they were good or not, since they are generic, and in a absolute background in the movie.

At the end, this is a very bad choice of movie, even to watch if there's nothing interesting in the TV: I had the displeasure of watching it in 720p. 

I'd advise to stay away from the Jabberwock - my score: 2,0 / 10,0.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":660,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2011-09-10","keywords":"sword and sorcery,monster","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Curse of the Dragon","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4222331673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTczZTkxMjctMTBlYi00YjZlLWJhOGItNjEyYTYxYmE2Y2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTczZTkxMjctMTBlYi00YjZlLWJhOGItNjEyYTYxYmE2Y2E4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Curse of the Dragon"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0671886/","name":"Tahmoh Penikett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0056041/","name":"Kacey Clarke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0214860/","name":"Raffaello Degruttola"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003458/","name":"Steven R. Monroe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054536/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0408885/","name":"Raul Inglis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1878140/","name":"Rafael Jordan"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: True Bloodthirst: Directed by Todor Chapkanov. With Andrew Lee Potts, Heida Reed, Claudia Bassols, Ben Lambert. Set in a not-too-distant future in which a synthetic blood substitute, dispensed by the Romanian government, allows humans and vampires to potentially co-exist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1982882/","name":"True Bloodthirst","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEyODQ0MTkxNDNeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDE0ODcwMTMx._V1_.jpg","description":"Set in a not-too-distant future in which a synthetic blood substitute, dispensed by the Romanian government, allows humans and vampires to potentially co-exist.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1982882/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ciprian-622-874587"},"dateCreated":"2013-08-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Storyline : Bucharest, Romania , Filming Locations: Bulgaria. This say it all...","reviewBody":"Quote "A little trivia...Romania once was known as Transylvania". Guess again ! ROmania is more than Transylvania, Moldavia and Wallachia . And YES this is really a SF movie...see Wikipedia.\n\nVampires are mythological or folkloric beings who subsist by feeding on the life essence (generally in the form of blood) of living creatures, regardless of whether they are undead or a living person/being.Although vampiric entities have been recorded in many cultures, and may go back to "prehistoric times", the term vampire was not popularized until the early 18th century, after an influx of vampire superstition into Western Europe from areas where vampire legends were frequent, such as the Balkans and Eastern Europe,[8] although local variants were also known by different names, such as vrykolakas in Greece and strigoi in Romania. This increased level of vampire superstition in Europe led to mass hysteria and in some cases resulted in corpses actually being staked and people being accused of vampirism."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1637,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.2},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2012-07-14","keywords":"vampire human coexistence,blood substitute","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Vampyre Nation","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3731400729","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjEzZjAxYjItNzczNi00MTU4LTg0YmQtMzQ0ZGM1MThkMjgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjEzZjAxYjItNzczNi00MTU4LTg0YmQtMzQ0ZGM1MThkMjgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Vampyre Nation"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0498517/","name":"Andrew Lee Potts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4008100/","name":"Heida Reed"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2218213/","name":"Claudia Bassols"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1359237/","name":"Todor Chapkanov"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0386431/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186146/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0080897/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0337962/","name":"Jeffrey Green"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1878140/","name":"Rafael Jordan"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

This increased level of vampire superstition in Europe led to mass hysteria and in some cases resulted in corpses actually being staked and people being accused of vampirism.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1637,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.2,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Horror","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2012-07-14","keywords":"vampire human coexistence,blood substitute","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Vampyre Nation","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3731400729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjEzZjAxYjItNzczNi00MTU4LTg0YmQtMzQ0ZGM1MThkMjgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjEzZjAxYjItNzczNi00MTU4LTg0YmQtMzQ0ZGM1MThkMjgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Vampyre Nation","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0498517/","name":"Andrew Lee Potts","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4008100/","name":"Heida Reed","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2218213/","name":"Claudia Bassols"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1359237/","name":"Todor Chapkanov"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0386431/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0186146/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0080897/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0337962/","name":"Jeffrey Green","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1878140/","name":"Rafael Jordan"],"duration":"PT1H30M"</script><metacontent="

Darkness Falls: Directed by Jonathan Liebesman. With Chaney Kley, Emma Caulfield Ford, Lee Cormie, Grant Piro. A vengeful spirit has taken the form of the Tooth Fairy to exact vengeance on the town that lynched her 150 years earlier. Her only opposition is the only child, now grown up, who has survived her before." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0282209/","name":"Darkness Falls","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjcwOGM4ZDUtOGFiZS00YTAxLWExMTQtMWQ1NGU2NTZjYjg5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A vengeful spirit has taken the form of the Tooth Fairy to exact vengeance on the town that lynched her 150 years earlier. Her only opposition is the only child, now grown up, who has survived her before.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0282209/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LessThanPaddy"},"dateCreated":"2017-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Severe nightmares once upon a time...","reviewBody":"Okay, I admit this may not be a great movie, but I don't think it is the worst either. However, I do think I'm only saying that because I loved it as a kid. Honestly, it was always the choice of scary film for me and my friends at sleepovers etc. It was scary, the tooth-fairy character is my idea of a worst nightmare, and believe me she gave me plenty in the years that followed. I haven't seen it in a few years and while it may not haunt me anymore I suspect it would give me an intermediate shiver if I watched it again today.

Usually I bash films like this. There are probably better horror films out there that I've given worse reviews too, but this one holds sentimental value for me and I genuinely believe that it's not THAT bad. The acting isn't wonderful and the story plays out a bit predictably... I still quite like the premise though and the legend behind Matilda the tooth-fairy.

If you scare easily, I wouldn't recommend you watch this alone. The movie might not be top, but it is full of jumps and the villain is horrifying. Enjoy (with the lights on).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31282,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Fantasy","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2003-05-21","keywords":"tooth fairy,darkness,night terrors,fear of the dark,supernatural horror","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Darkness Falls","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3634364697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0YTA0YzEtZTcyMS00YmI2LTkyZDEtNzg0MWYxZmUyZmJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTc0YTA0YzEtZTcyMS00YmI2LTkyZDEtNzg0MWYxZmUyZmJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Sony Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1015096/","name":"Chaney Kley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0146536/","name":"Emma Caulfield Ford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1112328/","name":"Antony Burrows"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0509448/","name":"Jonathan Liebesman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003580/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000532/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022564/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0364899/","name":"Joe Harris"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004591/","name":"John Fasano"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0888743/","name":"James Vanderbilt"}],"duration":"PT1H26M"}</script><metacontent="

Tremors
programme.desc:
Tremors: Directed by Ron Underwood. With Kevin Bacon, Fred Ward, Finn Carter, Michael Gross. Natives of a small isolated town defend themselves against strange underground creatures which are killing them one by one." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0100814/","name":"Tremors","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTEzNjkwMzIyMjZeQTJeQWpwZ15BbWU4MDI2NTU5ODYx._V1_.jpg","description":"Natives of a small isolated town defend themselves against strange underground creatures which are killing them one by one.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0100814/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TYLERdurden74"},"dateCreated":"1999-01-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cult Movies 18","reviewBody":"18. TREMORS (SCI-fiction, 1990) Welcome to Perfection, Nevada. Population: a couple. Opportunities: none. That's why handymen Val (Kevin Bacon) and Earl (Fred Ward) have always planned to leave town. And this time they mean it. Suddenly a series of bizarre killings prevent them from leaving. With the help of a seismology student, they discover giant-worm like creatures living under the desert sand. Now their goal is to leave town in one piece.

Critique: Lighthearted horror, sci-fi, comedy 'mish-mash' has an interesting premise, oddball characters, and wonderfully ferocious action. As our embattled heroes struggle to survive against the relentless creatures, the battle of wits that ensues becomes inventive and exciting. 

The film shares strange similarities with Spielberg's legendary 'Jaws'. As the suspense and body count mount, the threatening desert sand (water) becomes an infinite playground for the bloodthirsty worms (sharks), as they use scare tactics against their unbeknown victims (swimmers). Not knowing where they will strike next, people tiptoe their way across town trying not to alert the creatures. It all makes for 'TREMEndous' fun.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":130247,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Horror"],"datePublished":"1990-01-19","keywords":"desert,monster,giant worm,stranded on rooftop,first part","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000102/","name":"Kevin Bacon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911542/","name":"Fred Ward"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0141617/","name":"Finn Carter"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0881038/","name":"Ron Underwood"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0033220/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0079219/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0934093/","name":"S.S. Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0534681/","name":"Brent Maddock"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0881038/","name":"Ron Underwood"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="
