programme.title: The East
Ida
programme.desc:
The East: Directed by Zal Batmanglij. With Brit Marling, Alexander Skarsgård, Elliot Page, Toby Kebbell. An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1869716/","name":"The East","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEyNjQzMzg5Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjExNzU1OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities changing dramatically after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1869716/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"AvidClimber"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Stunning and unpretentious","reviewBody":"The East is the kind of movie that makes you want to join the fight, raise your voice and be heard.

The good. Extremely immersive. A incredible story with lots of emotions, conflicts, opposing moralities, and a stupefying journey. It is gripping and you will not be left unmoved.

The actors. Brit Marling and Ellen Page both give us a great performance. I was disappointed by Alexander Skarsgård, I thought that he was the weak player of the cast. The rest of the cell was pretty solid: Toby Kebbell, Shiloh Fernandez, Aldis Hodge, and Danielle Macdonald. And I should mention the nice work done by Patricia Clarkson as the director of the private security firm.

The bad. The ending is rushed. It feels like there was missing material at the end of filming and they couldn't go back to get what they needed and had to edit it with what they had.

The ugly. Nothing.

The result. A must see for anyone.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2013-06-28","keywords":"anarchist,ecoterrorism,environmental crime,nude swimming,male nudity","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Version","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2067179033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQxMzg2NjU0OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODYzNzM0OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An operative for an elite private intelligence firm finds her priorities irrevocably changed after she is tasked with infiltrating an anarchist group known for executing covert attacks upon major corporations. programme.title: Transplant
Transplant
Nowe życie
Transplant
programme.desc:
Transplant: Created by Joseph Kay. With Laurence Leboeuf, Hamza Haq, Ayisha Issa, Jim Watson. An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10936342/","name":"Transplant","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGRlYWY0ODctODRhZC00Nzg3LWEzYzUtOTFlNDg5N2RkMDc0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjk1NTYzMDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An ER doctor, who fled his native Syria to come to Canada, must overcome numerous obstacles to resume a career in the high stakes world of emergency medicine.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10936342/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2020-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Thankfully it's not another Grey's Anatomy, Chicago Med, etc. +EDIT","reviewBody":"So far so good. Not your typical Hospital TV show, in fact, it's uniqueness and stellar performances by Hamza Haq and John Hannah kept me captivated.

I did however feel there was "too much" focus on racism - an not the real struggle, and I hope that fades away as the main focus of the show. There were some obvious plot and technical issues - why wouldn't he say he's looking for his sister to the cop from the start? What's up with Ayisha Issa's characters crappy attitude? Thus I hope the melodrama also gets toned down a bit by the writers so this show doesn't end up like another Grey's Anatomy or General Hospital.

The directing, cinematography and score were spot-on in creating and maintaining the tension. Casting was also great with convincible characters - unlike Saving Hope where some doctors looked 16 years old.

I'm certainly hooked to see where this show goes next, but as of now, it's a well deserved 8/10 from me.

EDIT 4/29/20: I've lost interest. Bashir's sister looks more like his daughter. The accents are clearly fake, unconvincing and annoying. The icing on the cake is still the annoying Ayisha Issa's acting or character, or both - I still can't tell. She has the angriest look and worst bedside manner I've seen from and doctors show. She is unconvincing as a doctor. Alcoholics can have a drink every time she smiles - they'll still be sober. The writing is getting less exciting and barely interesting. From 8/10 down to 6/10. Wont be watching any more episodes."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3066,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-02-26","keywords":"doctor,hospital,emergency room,syrian refugee,brother sister relationship","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4407744/","name":"Hamza Haq"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0495799/","name":"Laurence Leboeuf"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001314/","name":"John Hannah"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0689402/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0120262/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0216142/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1075746/","name":"Joseph Kay"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Transplant: Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2522791449","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2ZiZTliYjktZjlhYi00ZjM1LTk2N2UtODYwYzI4YzA2ZWIyXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Transplant: Season 1"}}</script><metacontent="

Detainment
programme.desc: Twórca obrazu powraca do wstrząsającej sprawy morderstwa na 2-letnim Jamesie Bulgerze, które w 1993 roku popełnili dwaj 10-latkowie. Scenariusz bazuje na autentycznych policyjnych nagraniach z przesłuchań sprawców.

programme.title: Białe oko
White Eye
programme.desc: Przemierzając ulice miasta, Omer (Daniel Gad) dostrzega przy jednym z budynków swój skradziony rower. Chce znaleźć sposób, by go odzyskać. Nowy właściciel, Yunes (Dawit Tekelaeb), zarzeka się jednak, że kupił go tydzień temu. W sprawę niebawem angażuje się policja, a Omer nie zamierza ustąpić.

programme.title: Pogotowie remontowe Wieśka 4
programme.desc: Wiesiek Skiba pomaga ludziom, którzy stali się ofiarami nierzetelnych firm remontowych. Specjalista naprawi rozmaite usterki zgłoszone przez widzów. Udowodni też, że wiele drobnych remontów w kuchni, łazience, salonie czy na tarasie można zrobić samodzielnie.

programme.title: Kupione i co dalej? 2
programme.desc: Zakup mieszkania to początek przygody dla przyszłych lokatorów - przed nimi proces urządzania lokum. Ekipa programu pomoże im zweryfikować i zaplanować budżet remontowy nowo zakupionych nieruchomości.

programme.title: Zieja
Zieja
programme.desc:
Zieja: Directed by Robert Glinski. With Andrzej Seweryn, Mateusz Wieclawek, Zbigniew Zamachowski, Slawomir Orzechowski. The 70s. A Security Service Major wishes to "buy" gullible priest Zieja and turn him into an agent who will discredit the opposition. The priest's interrogations become a natural pretext for a journey through the history of Poland in the twentieth century: from the Bolshevik war of 1920, through World War II, up to modern times. It turns out that the seemingly naive Father Zieja is actually a clever rebel. The world he lived in was unacceptable to him. He was ahead of his time. A lonely journey without a passport to Rome in the 1930s turned into thoughts of a European Union. Performing the Catholic funeral rites of a woman who committed suicide (during the 20s of the past century) was an protest against the church's rules. Proclaiming the slogan "never kill anyone, not even your enemies" during the Second World War, was against patriotic mythologies and foretold future pacifist attitudes. Zieja puts his life and freedom on the line in the name of moral, ethical and religious values in which he believed. The film "Zieja" is rooted in the movement of Polish Catholicism, which is based on high ethical standards, poverty and tolerance, as well as respect and love for other human beings." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10136434/","name":"Zieja","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzcyMDNiZDctYjg3OS00OTU2LWE2ZGMtZThjZmM0YmI3NjQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The 70s. A Security Service Major wishes to "buy" gullible priest Zieja and turn him into an agent who will discredit the opposition. The priest's interrogations become a natural pretext for a journey through the history of Poland in","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10136434/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"morrison-dylan-fan"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"The passage of Jan Zieja.","reviewBody":"After having gone to see Tenet (2020) the day before I spoke to a friend on the phone about what other films were coming out. Getting told that the local Odeon were doing a one-off screening of a interesting-sounding Polish Drama later that day,I got set to meet Zieja.

Note:Some spoilers in review.

View on the film:

On opposing sides not only round the table, but also morally, Andrzej Seweryn and Zbigniew Zamachowski set the screen ablaze in Zieja and Grosicki's interrogation sequences, thanks to the stamping of feet frustration Zamachowski gives Grosicki being counted in this psychological duel with a upright, quiet confidence Seweryn has beaming from every word of Zieja.

A important figure sadly not that well known outside of Poland, the screenplay by Wojciech Lepianka spans a impressively compact bio-pic on Jan Zieja, going right back in flashbacks to Zieja's involvement in the Warsaw Uprising,to the 70's,where Zieja's liberal liturgical catches the attention of the Communists secret services.

Based around the interrogation with Zieja and Grosicki, Lepianka's consistent move to flashbacks gives what should be the centrepiece of the title a stop-start atmosphere, where just as tensions are starting to build, Lepianka steps back and enters a flashback.

Rolling up the opening sequence to Grosicki being a slob in bed, director Robert Glinski & cinematographer Witold Plociennik firmly place Zieja on the other side with graceful close-ups and splintered shadows casting a spiritual aura on Zieja.

Closely working with editor Ewa Smal, Glinski stylishly links Zieja's experience at the interrogation table with the horrors he's faced in life,via pristine match-cuts linking the flashbacks and the present into each other,along with eye-catch screen-wipes performed by Zieja walking across the screen to deliver a sermon.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":93,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-08-28","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0786614/","name":"Andrzej Seweryn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5851110/","name":"Mateusz Wieclawek"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0952498/","name":"Zbigniew Zamachowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0322894/","name":"Robert Glinski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0087308/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049230/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0503287/","name":"Wojciech Lepianka"}],"duration":"PT1H50M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 365 obiadów Mariety Mareckiej 2
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu Marieta Marecka w każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy nowe, często zaskakujące potrawy, które złożą się w gotowy plan na obiad dla całej rodziny. Udzieli też wielu cennych wskazówek.

programme.title: Nie bój ryby!
programme.desc: Bartosz Lisek pracował jako kucharz okrętowy. Chcąc urozmaicić żeglarską dietę, składającą się głównie z makaronu i mielonki, odwiedzał targi w każdym porcie. Kupował tam świeże ryby i różnorodne owoce morza. Teraz dzieli się przepisami, nad którymi pracował przez lata. Podpowiada też, które ryby są najzdrowsze. W każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy smakowite propozycje - przystawkę, zupę i drugie danie.

credits.actor: Bartosz Lisek

programme.title: Kucharskiego pomysł na kuchnię 2
programme.desc: Piotr Kucharski pokaże widzom, jak przełamać kulinarną rutynę i sprawić, by gotowanie było przyjemne, a jego efekt - smaczny.

programme.title: TkaniNOWE kreacje
programme.desc: Program prowadzony przez projektanta wnętrz i miłośnika nietuzinkowych rozwiązań, Artura Indykę. Specjalista podpowiada, jak dokonać szybkiej metamorfozy przestrzeni i odmienić oblicze sypialni, salonu czy pokoju dziecięcego. Pokaże widzom, jak wykorzystać do tego tkaniny dekoracyjne, użytkowe czy ozdobne, w tym również zasłony, dywany oraz wiele innych nieoczywistych materiałów.

programme.title: TkaniNOWE kreacje
programme.desc: Program prowadzony przez projektanta wnętrz i miłośnika nietuzinkowych rozwiązań, Artura Indykę. Specjalista podpowiada, jak dokonać szybkiej metamorfozy przestrzeni i odmienić oblicze sypialni, salonu czy pokoju dziecięcego. Pokaże widzom, jak wykorzystać do tego tkaniny dekoracyjne, użytkowe czy ozdobne, w tym również zasłony, dywany oraz wiele innych nieoczywistych materiałów.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 4
programme.desc: Program udowadnia, że niewielkim kosztem i przy użyciu ogólnodostępnych materiałów można odnowić każdy stary mebel i uczynić z niego nietuzinkową ozdobę każdego wnętrza. W czwartym sezonie programu projektant wnętrz Artur Indyka pokaże m.in. jak wykorzystać stare ławy do urządzenia kawalerki, jak zaaranżować pokój we wschodnim stylu oraz jak wykonać żyrandol ze starych winyli. Podejmie się też zrobienia pomocy terapeutycznych do pracy z dziećmi i dorosłymi w świetlicy psychologicznej.

Usually I do things while I'm watching tv but on the first episode I was hooked, my eyes glued to the screen and I couldn't stop. And I even watched the commercials it came with since I watched it on demand! And I wasn't irritated I was just anticipating the next episode. The first episode was just great, relatable and made me instantly want to buy her biography or memoir. Can't wait for more. History like this just fascinates me. I even read books on women hero's of World War Two because I feel like they are so underrepresented but are so inspiring and important in their own way. So this series was exactly what I needed right now.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":309,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Documentary","Biography"],"datePublished":"2020-10-04","keywords":"first lady of the united states of america,u.s. president,politician's wife,the white house,american politics","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000705/","name":"Robin Wright"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0617356/","name":"Kati Marton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7248272/","name":"Kate Andersen Brower"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0112302/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165168/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi586203417","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQxMmFmMDctMjlmNy00ZTVmLWFiODUtZjY5NmM3MDcwMmY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTQxMmFmMDctMjlmNy00ZTVmLWFiODUtZjY5NmM3MDcwMmY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 365 obiadów Mariety Mareckiej 2
programme.desc: Gospodyni programu Marieta Marecka w każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy nowe, często zaskakujące potrawy, które złożą się w gotowy plan na obiad dla całej rodziny. Udzieli też wielu cennych wskazówek.

programme.title: Nie bój ryby!
programme.desc: Bartosz Lisek pracował jako kucharz okrętowy. Chcąc urozmaicić żeglarską dietę, składającą się głównie z makaronu i mielonki, odwiedzał targi w każdym porcie. Kupował tam świeże ryby i różnorodne owoce morza. Teraz dzieli się przepisami, nad którymi pracował przez lata. Podpowiada też, które ryby są najzdrowsze. W każdym odcinku zaprezentuje trzy smakowite propozycje - przystawkę, zupę i drugie danie.

credits.actor: Bartosz Lisek

programme.title: Kucharskiego pomysł na kuchnię 2
programme.desc: Piotr Kucharski pokaże widzom, jak przełamać kulinarną rutynę i sprawić, by gotowanie było przyjemne, a jego efekt - smaczny.

programme.title: TkaniNOWE kreacje
programme.desc: Program prowadzony przez projektanta wnętrz i miłośnika nietuzinkowych rozwiązań, Artura Indykę. Specjalista podpowiada, jak dokonać szybkiej metamorfozy przestrzeni i odmienić oblicze sypialni, salonu czy pokoju dziecięcego. Pokaże widzom, jak wykorzystać do tego tkaniny dekoracyjne, użytkowe czy ozdobne, w tym również zasłony, dywany oraz wiele innych nieoczywistych materiałów.

programme.title: TkaniNOWE kreacje
programme.desc: Program prowadzony przez projektanta wnętrz i miłośnika nietuzinkowych rozwiązań, Artura Indykę. Specjalista podpowiada, jak dokonać szybkiej metamorfozy przestrzeni i odmienić oblicze sypialni, salonu czy pokoju dziecięcego. Pokaże widzom, jak wykorzystać do tego tkaniny dekoracyjne, użytkowe czy ozdobne, w tym również zasłony, dywany oraz wiele innych nieoczywistych materiałów.

programme.title: Meblokreacje 4
programme.desc: Program udowadnia, że niewielkim kosztem i przy użyciu ogólnodostępnych materiałów można odnowić każdy stary mebel i uczynić z niego nietuzinkową ozdobę każdego wnętrza. W czwartym sezonie programu projektant wnętrz Artur Indyka pokaże m.in. jak wykorzystać stare ławy do urządzenia kawalerki, jak zaaranżować pokój we wschodnim stylu oraz jak wykonać żyrandol ze starych winyli. Podejmie się też zrobienia pomocy terapeutycznych do pracy z dziećmi i dorosłymi w świetlicy psychologicznej.

credits.actor: Maciej Stuhr, Magdalena Cielecka, Michalina Łabacz, Eliza Rycembel, Zofia Wichłacz, Aleksandra Popławska, Robert Gonera, Piotr Głowacki, Krzysztof Pieczyński
Maciej Stuhr, Magdalena Cielecka, Michalina Łabacz, Eliza Rycembel, Zofia Wichłacz, Aleksandra Popławska, Robert Gonera, Piotr Głowacki, Krzysztof Pieczyński

programme.title: News+
programme.desc: Podsumowanie najważniejszych wydarzeń z aren sportowych. Omówienie sukcesów, rekordów i porażek. Program prowadzą zamiennie m.in. Piotr Karpiński, Piotr Salak, Wojciech Zawioła i Gabriel Rogaczewski.

Statyści
programme.desc: Statysci: Directed by Michal Kwiecinski. With Kinga Preis, Stanislaw Brudny, Krzysztof Kiersznowski, Malgorzata Buczkowska. Chinese film crew are looking for people with sadly-looking faces, and therefore decide to make a small Polish town their major filming location. But are Poles really as gloomy and depressed as they look like at first sight?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0896977/","name":"Statysci","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmRhNGVhMmItZjY4ZC00NTk3LThmMzItYWZmYzEwZTk1NGQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTc4MzI2NQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Chinese film crew are looking for people with sadly-looking faces, and therefore decide to make a small Polish town their major filming location. But are Poles really as gloomy and depressed as they look like at first sight?","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0896977/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"moi_kamiar"},"dateCreated":"2009-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Homage to Love and Happy Ending","reviewBody":"Just think of a Chinese film crew, trying to shoot a stupid melodramatic fare in Poland with Polish extras! Producer of numerous Wajda's films including KATYN, Michal Kwiecinski in a witty directorial venture, EXTRAS, explores how modern men think of surrendering to Chinese Wave and drowning in its vast sea, when there's nothing left in his homeland, but a wasteland! A big yes to EXTRAS (2006) and its Homage to Love and Happy Ending! However in this enthusiastic farce, most of deductions seem absurd - for instance it is clear that if the Chinese director announces that, "Poland is second China and China is second Poland", the Polish photographer replies, "The situation is not good in Poland!!!" The absurdity is resonated in the duologue's of the melodrama they're shooting. The alienated Polish characters and enhancement of their relationship during the work are phenomenally inspiring, but the Chinese stereotypes - especially the childish director with his beloved goldfish - are not convincing at all.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2006-10-27","keywords":"town","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695835/","name":"Kinga Preis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0115711/","name":"Stanislaw Brudny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0452609/","name":"Krzysztof Kiersznowski"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0477187/","name":"Michal Kwiecinski"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0034872/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1008161/","name":"Jaroslaw Sokól"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

Kiler
programme.desc: Kiler: Directed by Juliusz Machulski. With Cezary Pazura, Malgorzata Kozuchowska, Jerzy Stuhr, Janusz Rewinski. An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0127626/","name":"Kiler","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDRkNWMxYWEtODUwMC00ZDRjLWI0MmQtMjFjNTFiMDYwZDZiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjExODE1MDc@._V1_.jpg","description":"An innocent cab driver Jurek Kiler is mistaken for a contract killer and imprisoned. Soon, he is sprung by a mob boss who needs "Killer" for a few more jobs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0127626/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cjpok"},"dateCreated":"1999-06-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lots of action with funny twists","reviewBody":"This could easily be called the Polish version of "Pulp Fiction" but thank God, it is not. It is captivating from the very get-go, keeping the viewing audience as hostage to the very end. Although unique in style and approach, it is universal and could appeal to any audience, anywhere in the world. Humorous and tastefully prepared.No wonder Hollywood already bought rights to the story. We may see it on this side of the pond. I hope without Bruce Willis or other Hollywood screen "heroes". programme.title: Un homme pressé
Drugie życie pana Alaina
Un homme pressé
programme.desc:
Un homme pressé: Directed by Hervé Mimran. With Fabrice Luchini, Leïla Bekhti, Rebecca Marder, Igor Gotesman. A high profile businessman has let his personal life lapse in favor of corporate success. When he suffers a serious stroke he finds himself stripped back to zero. He learns to rebuild his life with the help of a therapist and his family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6948326/","name":"Un homme pressé","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjU1MGQyN2MtYjIyMC00YTVkLTlmMWUtZThiOTJiOTQxYTVmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjY1OTM1Mzc@._V1_.jpg","description":"A high profile businessman has let his personal life lapse in favor of corporate success. When he suffers a serious stroke he finds himself stripped back to zero. He learns to rebuild his life with the help of a therapist and his fam","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6948326/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mozjoukine"},"dateCreated":"2019-03-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"French comedy on suspect subject","reviewBody":"We star with the premise that if in a Film like LES INTOUCHABLE spinal paralysis is funny, stroke victims must be good for a laugh though, to give them credit, they do show recovering patient Fabrice Luchini a ward filled with grim fellow victims on respirators unable to move in their beds.

Derived from the non fiction book "J'étais un homme pressé" by Christian Streiff former CEO of Airbus and PSA Peugeot-Citroen, this one shows the rich Luchini character as a hard serving executive who intimidates all. It takes all the Luchini charm to make this guy acceptable.

He collapses on the way to work and we get into the story where, still in denial, Luchini is made to realise that he has lost his control of language, this with a major address to an executive meeting in Geneva coming up - jokes like him greeting people by saying goodbye and other malapropisms that must have given the sub-titlers nighmares. His ordering a turd from an unfazed waiter at the cafe defeats them.

He recruits hospital speech therapist Leïla Bekhti full time and starts to develop drills to restore his lost vocabulary and memory of the lay out of his district. Bored with the kids' picture books she uses he switches to the Jardin des Plantes menagerie and it's real animals.

Drone shot downwards on a speeding express train and we get a King's Speech scene in Geneva which he aces bit is still shown the door.

At which point the film starts again as Luchini settles in to sort out the relationship with his daughter (that doesn't go too well) and Béhkti, before his European hiking tour accompanied by his faithful dog - much stamping of his passport and alpine scenics. The scene setting is particularly deft in this one.

The central performance is superior but when they've set up support players so well it's unsatisfying to not find their stories given an outcome.

Lush feel good European movie of the kind that plays well in English speaking country art theaters."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1517,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2018-11-07","keywords":"reference to montgomery clift,reference to gregory peck,reference to peter lorre,reference to humphrey bogart,vehicle design","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi247118361","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlZjNlMzctY2I3Yi00ZmE2LTgwZTQtYzM4ZDAzMmFmNzkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlZjNlMzctY2I3Yi00ZmE2LTgwZTQtYzM4ZDAzMmFmNzkyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0524528/","name":"Fabrice Luchini"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1871951/","name":"Leïla Bekhti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2406198/","name":"Rebecca Marder"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1773597/","name":"Hervé Mimran"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0315631/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172053/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1773597/","name":"Hervé Mimran"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0277229/","name":"Hélène Fillières"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7013534/","name":"Christian Streiff"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: I Am Greta
Jestem Greta
I Am Greta
programme.desc: I Am Greta: Directed by Nathan Grossman. With Greta Thunberg, Svante Thunberg, Niclas Svenningsen, António Guterres. The documentary follows Greta Thunberg, a teenage climate activist from Sweden, on her international crusade to get people to listen to scientists about the world's environmental problems." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10394738/","name":"I Am Greta","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjVjMzcyZDktNzFhOC00NTY2LTkxMjAtMjJkN2U3ZWZkMzUwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDU5MDEyMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The documentary follows Greta Thunberg, a teenage climate activist from Sweden, on her international crusade to get people to listen to scientists about the world's environmental problems.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10394738/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Xstal"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Polaricing Persona...","reviewBody":"It's disturbing that so much vitriol and hate can be targeted at a young woman whose only wish is for the governments of the world to recognise the overwhelming evidence that supports climate change and for them to do something about it before it's too late (assuming it's not too late already). Conversely, it's refreshing and inspiring to know that a young woman has been able to mobilise such a strong and powerful force to fight against the intransigence and/or misinformation pedalled primarily by biased middle aged and older men; although this is primarily a documentary about a person and not a movement. That person is trying to change the world for the better and, with the help, support and vision of the youth of today (and a few others), let's wish her success in her crusade against greed, corruption and ignorance while joining her in the fight for our survival!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7484,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Documentary","Biography"],"datePublished":"2020-10-16","keywords":"environmental activist,climate crisis,teenage girl,female activist,global warming","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000980761","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGZmOWQzMWQtMGIwZS00ZjVmLWE0YzItODIwNzU2ZWQzNDFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGZmOWQzMWQtMGIwZS00ZjVmLWE0YzItODIwNzU2ZWQzNDFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"This documentary follows teenage climate activist Greta Thunberg on her international crusade to get people to listen to scientists about the world's environmental problems."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10361418/","name":"Greta Thunberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2468871/","name":"Svante Thunberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm12524895/","name":"Niclas Svenningsen"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5548363/","name":"Nathan Grossman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0337495/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0218858/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0075650/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2408218/","name":"Hanna Lejonqvist"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456599/","name":"Per K. programme.title: My Salinger Year
Mój rok z Salingerem
My Salinger Year
programme.desc:
My Salinger Year: Directed by Philippe Falardeau. With Margaret Qualley, Sigourney Weaver, Douglas Booth, Seána Kerslake. A college grad takes a clerical job working for the literary agent of the renowned, reclusive writer J.D. Salinger." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2222052/","name":"My Salinger Year","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzNDM4YWMtZWE5Ny00MTliLWEzY2ItODU0NmE2ZTUzMDhlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTE1MzI2NzIz._V1_.jpg","description":"A college grad takes a clerical job working for the literary agent of the renowned, reclusive writer J.D. Salinger.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2222052/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"imseeg"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-09","inLanguage":"English","name":"Playful, charming, beautiful, original and witty. Unknown GEM!","reviewBody":"BRAVO, what a charming, playful, subtle, witty and original movie this is. A delight to watch!

The story: a young woman leaves everything behind to become a writer in the big city New York. Will she succeed or will she become another failed writer?

The good: this movie is a delight, because of it's playful, charming, subtle and witty nature. You dont have to be into books at all to love this movie.

What's most precious for me about this movie is the photography, especially the many GORGEOUS still screen shots of MARGARET QUALLEY. Those eyes of her, those wide open puppy eyes, ooze innocence and emotions so pure and gentle that they are to die for! Never seen this actress before, but I am instantly smitten with her acting performance, so delicate, so true to life, so expressive.

Any bad? This is a slowburning, subtle story, probably best suited for an arthouse movie audience who are into subtle portraits of characters. A feast to watch! Amazing to see it has only gotten 32 reviews, but it must be the corona troubles with distributing movies that this has slipped from the radar, because it is definitely worth watching every single minute. What a gem!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3302,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-03-05","keywords":"writer","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer (2021)","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi728351001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM5NjRkMzMtY2QyMi00Y2NmLWEyOTQtY2IwNWRmOTVmNTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGM5NjRkMzMtY2QyMi00Y2NmLWEyOTQtY2IwNWRmOTVmNTE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXNuZXNodQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"New York in the 90s: After leaving graduate school to pursue her dream of becoming a writer, Joanna (Margaret Qualley) gets hired as an assistant to Margaret (Sigourney Weaver), the stoic and old-fashioned literary agent of J. D. Salinger. Fluctuating between poverty and glamour, she spends her days in a plush, wood-paneled office – where dictaphones and typewriters still reign and agents doze off after three-martini lunches – and her nights in a sink-less Brooklyn apartment with her socialist boyfriend. Joanna’s main task is processing Salinger’s voluminous fan mail, but as she reads the heart-wrenching letters from around the world, she becomes reluctant to send the agency’s impersonal standard letter and impulsively begins personalizing the responses. The results are both humorous and moving, as Joanna, while using the great writer’s voice, begins to discover her own."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4960279/","name":"Margaret Qualley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000244/","name":"Sigourney Weaver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3150488/","name":"Douglas Booth"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0265852/","name":"Philippe Falardeau"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0089507/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0044330/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0265852/","name":"Philippe Falardeau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5117507/","name":"Joanna Smith Rakoff"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Family
Rodzinka
Family
programme.desc: Family: Directed by Laura Steinel. With Taylor Schilling, Bryn Vale, Brian Tyree Henry, Jessie Ennis. Kate Stone is career-focused, and enjoys her life that way. Her brash attitude keeps relationships at arm's length, making her an outcast in her own right." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6268882/","name":"Family","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkyOTQzMjE4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTMwMDE4NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Kate Stone is career-focused, and enjoys her life that way. Her brash attitude keeps relationships at arm's length, making her an outcast in her own right.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6268882/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"IboChild"},"dateCreated":"2019-04-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Eschews Hollywood Tropes While Embracing an Edgier Approach","reviewBody":"In a typical Hollywood film, the protagonist has to be likeable. If she's a career woman, more often than not she's also obsessed with finding a man. "Family" throws those and other familiar tropes out of window. Another is the too-cute-for-own-good sidekick or child, who shows the protagonist how to be a better person. Kate (Taylor Schilling) is a mean and self-absorbed executive when she is forced to take care of her awkward neice Maddie (Bryn Vale), who'd rather be doing roundhouse karate kicks than pirouettes in ballet class. Sure, the two learn from each other, but not necessarily in ways that typical movie audiences would expect. Depending on your sensibility, this could be either refreshing or infuriating, but never boring. The cast of mostly fresh faces keep things moving along. For those looking for a comedy with more of an edge than the typical film showing at the multplex, "Family" is definitely worth a look.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2620,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-04-19","keywords":"juggalo,aunt,bullying,karate,coffee","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi531873049","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NjliNDQtNmVjMi00ODA2LWIxN2QtZTBlMGMwNGJkNzgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM1NjliNDQtNmVjMi00ODA2LWIxN2QtZTBlMGMwNGJkNzgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An emotionally-stunted aunt tries to bond with her 13-year-old niece, who wants nothing more than to run away from home and become a juggalo."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2279940/","name":"Taylor Schilling"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6487294/","name":"Bryn Vale"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3109964/","name":"Brian Tyree Henry"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5144372/","name":"Laura Steinel"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0579930/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0222021/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5144372/","name":"Laura Steinel"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 127 Hours
127 godzin
127 Hours
programme.desc:
127 Hours: Directed by Danny Boyle. With James Franco, Kate Mara, Amber Tamblyn, Sean Bott. A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1542344/","name":"127 Hours","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2NjMzOTE3Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDE0OTc5Mw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1542344/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jpbrumby"},"dateCreated":"2012-02-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"A life-affirming near-death experience","reviewBody":"A hiking and climbing trip in the mountains of Utah goes wrong for rock-climber Aron Ralston (James Franco) as a loose boulder falls and crushes his arm against the rock wall. Equipped with a half-empty bottle of water, a digital camera, some rope and a (very) dull blade, Ralston must take stock of the situation and figure out a way to escape.

The film is tight, pacey and not nearly as boring as it could have been in the hands of a more literal director. Danny Boyle and co. infuse every scene with energy, wowing viewers with panoramic cinematography and drilling the hard truths home when the time comes.

Ralston gets his arm trapped a mere 15 minutes in and from then on it's Man vs. Rock. Boyle brings his distinctive brand of energy to the potentially static set-up, with an unpredictable and often inspired soundtrack and the surreal tangents so successfully employed in his early classic, 'Trainspotting'. Though Ralston himself may not move, his mind wanders through old memories and viewers are transported with him.

Boyle has a talent for finding the life-affirming elements hidden deep within grim situations and '127 Hours' is nothing if not an exercise in hope and determination. Franco tracks Ralston's fight over the days with a sense of realism that brings the climber's plight into sharp focus, ensuring that there is much more to this film than limb-hacking.

The premise is handled well and the cast and crew know the strengths of the story; the scenery is beautiful and the human elements are as familiar as they are sad, brave and ultimately liberating. When the time comes, having accompanied Ralston through his trials and setbacks, you will be there with him when the helicopter lands.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":363335,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2011-03-02","keywords":"survival,alone,based on autobiography,aron ralston,mountain climber","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"127 Hours: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi768149785","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNjI4MDI4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxMzIzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNjI4MDI4NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDMxMzIzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A mountain climber becomes trapped under a boulder while canyoneering alone near Moab, Utah and resorts to desperate measures in order to survive."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0290556/","name":"James Franco"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0848554/","name":"Amber Tamblyn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0544718/","name":"Kate Mara"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000965/","name":"Danny Boyle"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0064141/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000965/","name":"Danny Boyle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0064479/","name":"Simon Beaufoy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1737008/","name":"Aron Ralston"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: 25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy
25 lat niewinności. Sprawa Tomka Komendy
programme.desc:
25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy: Directed by Jan Holoubek. With Piotr Trojan, Agata Kulesza, Dariusz Chojnacki, Jan Frycz. The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11368998/","name":"25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2E3YWNhMTgtMzRiZS00N2UxLWJkYzEtOGYyMWFhNDhlZmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11368998/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"v-26640"},"dateCreated":"2021-01-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A powerful movie about how person can be sentenced on circumstantial evidences.","reviewBody":"Tomasz Komenda was sentenced about 3 years after the crime had been committed basing on simple idea - 'find me a man and we fill forge evidences against him'. What this move does not show is that at that time Attorney General, now deceased Lech Kaczynski had been urged that a killer is found and sentenced to silence medias hysteria and coverage about brutal murder and rape of that young girl. Later when the murder was put on Tomasz, he was publicly defamed by Lech Kaczynski. Despite Mr L. Kaczynski death in Smolensk plane crash and after Tomasz was exonerated, no polish public institution nor police have never apologized Tomasz for their actions, which is a standard practice in western democratic countries.

Not much changed in post-soviet bloc however after 1990 in terms of judiciary mentality. Human Rights Watch estimates that 1-3% of sentences in Poland may be those in which innocent people are sentenced just because either suspects were threatened by police to force to confess by beatings. No effective police control and their procedures exists as of today. You may call it a mafia or not but I believe it's not far from truth in Poland.

Personally I believe his family did not do enough to get him out of prison, a good lawyer would smash the case easily and he is worth every money, why did it happen 15 years later is a mystery for me.

IMDb data; ttnr: 11368998, Title: 25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy, --- Description: 25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy: Directed by Jan Holoubek. With Piotr Trojan, Agata Kulesza, Dariusz Chojnacki, Jan Frycz. The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11368998/","name":"25 lat niewinnosci. Sprawa Tomka Komendy","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2E3YWNhMTgtMzRiZS00N2UxLWJkYzEtOGYyMWFhNDhlZmExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEwMTY3NDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The ordinary life of Tomasz Komenda is turned upside down when he is wrongly accused of brutal murder and sentenced to 25 years in prison.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11368998/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"v-26640","dateCreated":"2021-01-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"A powerful movie about how person can be sentenced on circumstantial evidences.","reviewBody":"Tomasz Komenda was sentenced about 3 years after the crime had been committed basing on simple idea - 'find me a man and we fill forge evidences against him'. What this move does not show is that at that time Attorney General, now deceased Lech Kaczynski had been urged that a killer is found and sentenced to silence medias hysteria and coverage about brutal murder and rape of that young girl. Later when the murder was put on Tomasz, he was publicly defamed by Lech Kaczynski. Despite Mr L. Kaczynski death in Smolensk plane crash and after Tomasz was exonerated, no polish public institution nor police have never apologized Tomasz for their actions, which is a standard practice in western democratic countries.

Not much changed in post-soviet bloc however after 1990 in terms of judiciary mentality. Human Rights Watch estimates that 1-3% of sentences in Poland may be those in which innocent people are sentenced just because either suspects were threatened by police to force to confess by beatings. No effective police control and their procedures exists as of today. You may call it a mafia or not but I believe it's not far from truth in Poland.

Personally I believe his family did not do enough to get him out of prison, a good lawyer would smash the case easily and he is worth every money, why did it happen 15 years later is a mystery for me.

As Tomasz said after his release, there are no good people in prisons , there is only evil.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":884,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-18","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3825975/","name":"Piotr Trojan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0474492/","name":"Agata Kulesza","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2621963/","name":"Dariusz Chojnacki"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1450132/","name":"Jan Holoubek"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0015575/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0185099/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1733303/","name":"Andrzej Golda","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1450132/","name":"Jan Holoubek"],"duration":"PT1H56M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Wielka szpera
programme.desc: Wrzesień 1942 roku, getto w Łodzi. Niemcy ogłaszają zakaz opuszczania domów i organizują wywózkę ponad 15 tysięcy żydowskich dzieci oraz starców do obozu zagłady w Chełmnie. Te wstrząsające wydarzenia przeszły do historii pod nazwą "Wielkiej szpery". Przed kamerą mówią o niej ludzie, którzy przeżyli tamte tragiczne dni.

programme.title: Foals - Rip Up the Road
programme.desc: Rok z życia muzyków z zespołu Foals, luminarzy brytyjskiej sceny indierockowej. Kamera śledzi artystów podczas światowej trasy koncertowej, obejmującej dwa słynne występy w Alexandra Palace w Londynie. Było to niezwykle intensywne dwanaście miesięcy w ich karierze. Twórcy ukazują codzienną pracę artystów i towarzyszące jej emocje.

programme.title: Hollywood Buzz
programme.desc: W programie nowości kinowe, relacje z planów zdjęciowych oraz ciekawostki związanych z gwiazdami srebrnego ekranu. O pracy nad najnowszymi hollywoodzkimi produkcjami opowiadają ich twórcy - znani reżyserzy i aktorzy. Autorzy magazynu przedstawiają również zwiastuny filmów wchodzących na ekrany kin.

programme.desc: 10 giorni senza mamma: Directed by Alessandro Genovesi. With Fabio De Luigi, Valentina Lodovini, Angelica Elli, Bianca Usai. programme.title: Kto wrobił Britney Spears?
programme.desc: W 2008 roku gwiazda pop, która niegdyś osiągnęła spektakularny sukces, decyzją sądu została ubezwłasnowolniona. Po latach rozpoczęła walkę o odzyskanie kontroli nad swoim życiem, w czym wspierają ją rzesze fanów. Stoją oni murem za piosenkarką i twierdzą, że powinna sama o sobie decydować. Autorzy dokumentu pokazują kulisy prawnej batalii, jaką Britney Spears toczy ze swoim ojcem Jamesem. Stawką jest sprawowanie kurateli nad gwiazdą i zarządzanie jej majątkiem.

programme.title: Parenthood
Spokojnie, tatuśku
Parenthood
programme.desc:
Parenthood: Directed by Ron Howard. With Steve Martin, Mary Steenburgen, Dianne Wiest, Jason Robards. The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098067/","name":"Parenthood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3OTIwNzI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjgwNTcxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098067/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"chasman99"},"dateCreated":"2006-04-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Forever relevant","reviewBody":"I recall seeing this when it was released in '89. I found it funny but was only a Junior in high school at the time. Much of the humor and pain/struggle was lost on me. I rediscovered this on TV yesterday and just could not turn it off.

Having been married for a while and having kids of my own really brings this picture into focus. It is an amazing rendition of various families and how they are existing and treating their children. I identified so completely with Steve Martin's character that is was a bit scary.

I can see this film lasting the test of time very well. You can watch it as an outsider and enjoy the chaos or find yourself in one of the characters and enjoy the irony. Another Ron Howard masterpiece.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47745,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1989-08-02","keywords":"vomiting,dysfunctional family,cake,horse riding,happiness","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Parenthood","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi126786329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ0MTY1MmUtMjZhZS00OWEzLTg3N2EtMGYzZjhhMDEwYWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ0MTY1MmUtMjZhZS00OWEzLTg3N2EtMGYzZjhhMDEwYWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Parenthood"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005460/","name":"Mary Steenburgen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001848/","name":"Dianne Wiest"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304665/","name":"Lowell Ganz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0541632/","name":"Babaloo Mandel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"}],"duration":"PT2H4M"}</script><metacontent="

The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098067/","name":"Parenthood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ3OTIwNzI2OV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjgwNTcxMTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Buckmans are a midwestern family all dealing with their lives: estranged relatives, raising children, pressures of the job, and learning to be a good parent and spouse.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098067/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"chasman99","dateCreated":"2006-04-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Forever relevant","reviewBody":"I recall seeing this when it was released in '89. I found it funny but was only a Junior in high school at the time. Much of the humor and pain/struggle was lost on me. I rediscovered this on TV yesterday and just could not turn it off.

Having been married for a while and having kids of my own really brings this picture into focus. It is an amazing rendition of various families and how they are existing and treating their children. I identified so completely with Steve Martin's character that is was a bit scary.

I can see this film lasting the test of time very well. You can watch it as an outsider and enjoy the chaos or find yourself in one of the characters and enjoy the irony. Another Ron Howard masterpiece.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47745,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"1989-08-02","keywords":"vomiting,dysfunctional family,cake,horse riding,happiness","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Parenthood","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi126786329","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ0MTY1MmUtMjZhZS00OWEzLTg3N2EtMGYzZjhhMDEwYWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGQ0MTY1MmUtMjZhZS00OWEzLTg3N2EtMGYzZjhhMDEwYWUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Parenthood","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000188/","name":"Steve Martin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005460/","name":"Mary Steenburgen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001848/","name":"Dianne Wiest"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0003687/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304665/","name":"Lowell Ganz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0541632/","name":"Babaloo Mandel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000165/","name":"Ron Howard"],"duration":"PT2H4M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Sting
Żądło
The Sting
programme.desc:
The Sting: Directed by George Roy Hill. With Paul Newman, Robert Redford, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning. Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0070735/","name":"The Sting","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU3NjQ4YTMtZGJjOS00YTQ3LThmNmItMTI5MDE2ODI3NzY3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjUzOTY1NTc@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two grifters team up to pull off the ultimate con.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0070735/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"SilverDSam"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"Comment on accuracy of the poker scene","reviewBody":"The Sting.

The Sting (1973) is one of everybody's favorite films. Director George Roy Hill took a page from his successful western, Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid, and teamed Paul Newman and Robert Redford once again, this time for an Academy Award four star movie about con men.

The intricate saga of The Sting is set in 1936 Chicago. It tells the story of grifters, Henry Gondorff and Johnny Hooker, played by Paul Newman and Robert Redford, respectively. They con the bad guy, Doyle Lonnegan, played by Robert Shaw. And at every turn, they con the audience as well.

The poker game is five card draw ('straight poker' in the film) and is set on a train traveling from New York to Chicago. Newman and Redford are on the train along with Shaw. The game has been set up by Shaw with the cooperation of the conductor. We don't know how Newman and Redford know exactly what day and what train Shaw is taking from New York to Chicago, but that is beside the purpose of our discussion. Shaw is a known card cheater, but Newman will prove to be a better one. Once again the holy game of poker will be sullied by the movies. This time, we'll love every minute of it.

Newman arranges to get himself invited to the poker game, through the conductor. He arrives sober, but apparently inebriated. It is the perfect act, consummately played in a boozy, needling performance by Paul Newman. 

Shaw's character is a known cold decker (a 'cold deck' is a deck introduced surreptitiously into the game with hands pre-arranged to break one of the players)' and Newman will have to play over the top of the cold deck when it is placed into the game.

One of the subtleties of the event is missed by most viewers. Newman must ready himself to overcome the cold deck. During the play of hands, we see Newman hold the cards close to his vest and, at least once, his cards disappear briefly below table level, out of sight, and back again. Newman knows Shaw cold decks middle cards against low cards, and so Newman is gathering and holding out jacks.

Newman immediately insults Shaw upon arrival and continues to heckle him throughout the play of the game, thus making sure Shaw will cold deck the game to teach the upstart drunk a lesson. When Shaw goes to the men's room to arrange to fix the cold deck, Newman knows the time has come. (In real life, cold decks were nearly always arranged in men's rooms. They should have had a dedicated stall marked 'coolers made here'.)

The game is three handed at this point. Shaw will bring the cold deck in when he cuts the cards for the dealer to his left. In filming the cold decking, the camera shows a pair of hands over the deck, then there's a cut in the continuity. Then the camera goes immediately back to the deck and we see the hands with the warm deck going to a handkerchief in Shaw's lap, leaving the cold deck on the table. I guess it would have been hard to do in one long shot.

The detail is interesting during the dealing of the cold deck. Newman is fussing with his cigar and poking behind his vest, implying something is happening. But we never see Newman with hand positions that could be holding out cards.

Newman is dealt trip threes and Shaw is dealt a pair of nines. The third player is the dealer and he is out of the hand. Newman draws two cards and gets his four threes with the six of hearts. Shaw draws three cards and gets his four nines with the ten of spades.

The planning of the arranged cold deck is well done and probable. After the cards are dealt, the cards on top of the deck are, in order, a three, the six of hearts, two nines and the ten of spades. It doesn't matter whether Newman draws one or two cards, he'll make his four threes and, in either case, Shaw, in drawing three cards, will make his four nines.

Now, here's the unlikely trick. Newman must change the hand with four threes for a hand with four jacks. It would be easiest to hold out an entire hand of four jacks and a fifth card and switch five card hands. But Newman switches only the four threes for the four jacks he's held out and he keeps the six of hearts. That is much harder to do and less likely would be the method chosen. Newman also takes the chance that Shaw won't have one of the legitimate jacks in his hand with the four nines, but in having to play over the top of the cold deck, that gamble is unavoidable.

Shaw's problem is that he can't call Newman for card manipulation because Shaw has an audience, the other players and the conductor. After Newman leaves the cabin, Shaw says to his lackey, 'What was I supposed to do? Call him for cheating better than me, in front of the others?'

Shaw was able to get $10,000 more in chips during a hand in a table stakes game. But that was okay with Newman.

The film shows Shaw wiping his face with a handkerchief during the play of the hand, implying he has disposed of the warm deck. However, we never see Newman clean up. So, when he leaves the poker cabin, one deck is short four jacks, the other deck has four extra jacks, and Newman still has four threes behind his vest somewhere. Whoever the conductor gives the decks to next, will have a few surprises.

Despite its faults, the poker scene from The Sting is the most fun filled, greatest directed, best acted, and most involved offering in cheating poker film history. And it was made over thirty years ago.

Silver Dollar Sam NothingWild.com"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":252642,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1973-12-25","keywords":"con,con man,illegal activity,playing golf,con artist","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Sting","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2717122841","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5ZDllM2QtZjg2MS00NjA1LWE2ZTEtNmU2MTBkM2U2MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM5ZDllM2QtZjg2MS00NjA1LWE2ZTEtNmU2MTBkM2U2MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000056/","name":"Paul Newman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000602/","name":"Robert Redford"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001727/","name":"Robert Shaw"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001351/","name":"George Roy Hill"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019166/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911486/","name":"David S. Ward"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

Music
programme.desc: Music: Directed by Sia. With Maddie Ziegler, Mary Kay Place, Leslie Odom Jr., Braeden Marcott. Zu is newly sober when she receives news that she is to become the sole guardian of her half-sister named Music, a young girl on the autism spectrum. The film explores two of Sia's favorite themes: finding your voice and creating family." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7541720/","name":"Music","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTIwZjFmNmYtZTI3YS00MGFiLTllYjUtZGNlNWJiMmM2ZmY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Zu is newly sober when she receives news that she is to become the sole guardian of her half-sister named Music, a young girl on the autism spectrum. You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
programme.desc: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid: Directed by Caroline Labrèche. With Tori Anderson, Kristopher Turner, Julia Borsellino, Sarah Orenstein. Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. Her life gets put on hold when she returns to her hometown for her sister Maddie's wedding. Scarlett learns that her parents have sold the family home, a B&B, to her childhood flame Liam Perry and that Maddie has lost her wedding venue days before the nuptials. Scarlett suggests they host the event at the B&B and works with Liam to pull off the wedding of Maddie's dreams, trying to put their history behind them. As her dream job in NYC becomes a firm offer, Scarlett is forced to make a decision. She has been falling back in love with Liam and with her childhood home. With the countdown to the wedding day on, will Liam Perry get to kiss the bridesmaid?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12829388/","name":"You May Kiss the Bridesmaid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI3MTQwNzgtYmIzNy00YWI3LWIxMGEtYmE5YmU1YmVmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. programme.title: Shadow in the Cloud
Obcy pasażer
Shadow in the Cloud
programme.desc:
Shadow in the Cloud: Directed by Roseanne Liang. With Chloë Grace Moretz, Nick Robinson, Beulah Koale, Taylor John Smith. A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9691136/","name":"Shadow in the Cloud","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWNiNGQyMzUtN2VmMi00NDI2LWI3NGUtMTEwZGQxYzFjZTNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyNDk3MjY3._V1_.jpg","description":"A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9691136/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TxMike"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Kick-Ass grown up, in WW2, and Rod Serling would be proud.","reviewBody":"The old Twilight Zone TV shows, remember the monster on the airplane wing? This movie does that old TV series proud.

Most of the very bad ratings here are given by viewers who somehow took this for a serious movie. It is not. It is a spoof of sorts, of the competent hard-working women of WW2, and the old signs cautioning workers to avoid gremlins. Here the gremlins are real, they are dangerous, and a super woman of sorts has to save the day.

Chloë Grace Moretz ten years earlier starred in Kick Ass, another movie not to be taken too seriously. Here she is Maude Garrett who boards a military flight out of New Zealand in 1943, presenting "orders" that she is supposed to be there with a top secret package.

This movie is about as real as the old Bugs Bunny and Roadrunner cartoons. I was invested all the way and found it to be entertaining, fun escapism. That's all it is. Moretz is great.

At home on DVD from my public library, my wife skipped."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22359,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Horror","War"],"datePublished":"2021-01-01","keywords":"boeing b 17 flying fortress,world war two,electronic music score,1940s,year 1943","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Teaser","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3659972889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThlYWYxY2UtZTQxMy00ZjkyLWExNDMtMjc4MDAzMThmZTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNThlYWYxY2UtZTQxMy00ZjkyLWExNDMtMjc4MDAzMThmZTAyXkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"A female WWII pilot traveling with top secret documents on a B-17 Flying Fortress encounters an evil presence on board the flight."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1631269/","name":"Chloë Grace Moretz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3538718/","name":"Nick Robinson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3872230/","name":"Beulah Koale"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1755396/","name":"Roseanne Liang"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0308127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0628817/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0484840/","name":"Max Landis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1755396/","name":"Roseanne Liang"}],"duration":"PT1H23M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Wind in the Willows
O czym szumią wierzby
The Wind in the Willows
programme.desc: The Wind in the Willows: Directed by Terry Jones. With Steve Coogan, Eric Idle, Terry Jones, Antony Sher. Mole's underground home is bought by the Weasels from wealthy landowner Mr. Toad and Mole is thrown out. He and Rat start to fight to get his home back from evil Weasels." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118172/","name":"The Wind in the Willows","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MTg4MzE4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzY3NDUyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mole's underground home is bought by the Weasels from wealthy landowner Mr. Toad and Mole is thrown out. He and Rat start to fight to get his home back from evil Weasels.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118172/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2009-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"I liked it, but I also felt it was a bit clumsy!","reviewBody":"Don't get me wrong, I did really like it, but like most films, there were a number of flaws that undermined what could have been a fun romp for kids. The first, and main problem, was the story. There were some times when it bared some resemblance to one of the best children's books ever written, up there with Peter Pan and the Hans Christian Anderson Fairy tales, for imagination and complexity. However, I especially disliked the dog meat factory subplot, that's where it got really clumsy and it made the climax feel really cluttered. The songs were also nothing to write home about. They were fun to listen to (especially the Weasel song), but they were definitely forgettable. The direction, by I think Terry Jones(also actor), lacked at times the director's usual silliness and fun. There were some scenes, like the train scene where the action felt a bit rushed. However, there were a number of redeeming qualities to the film. Some scenes, like the introduction to Rat, were beautifully shot, and reminded me of Three Men in a Boat. The sets and scenery are very colourful and pretty and the costumes didn't bother me all that much, admittedly though some of the special effects were so-so. The script was good, very witty at times, with some priceless lines especially with Toad, Badger and St John, while maintaining the book's gentleness and drollness which I liked. The performances were in general excellent especially Nicol Williamson as Badger, who brought a much needed gruffness to the character as well as having a gift for comedy. Steve Coogan was touching as Mole. Eric Idle and Terry Jones were very funny in their roles, Idle is wonderfully sympathetic and jovial while Jones has a ball as the juiciest character. The courtroom scene was hilarious because of Toad's increasingly silly breaking-into- song moments, and was the highlight of the film. John Cleese and Stephen Fry were good(Cleese especially), but their appearances were too brief. Anthony Sher was adequately menacing as Chief Weasel, but like everyone else involved, he has been better. All in all, a likable, colourful and funny but unfortunately at times clumsy film, with a 7/10. Bethany Cox","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3203,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2000-06-21","keywords":"weasel,mole,toad,rat,mating","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Wind in the Willows","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi418560793","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWMxMmZmZGEtNjZkMC00NjdiLWIyMWYtNzY5NWQ3NWQyMGMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWMxMmZmZGEtNjZkMC00NjdiLWIyMWYtNzY5NWQ3NWQyMGMzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176869/","name":"Steve Coogan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001385/","name":"Eric Idle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001402/","name":"Terry Jones"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001402/","name":"Terry Jones"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052092/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001402/","name":"Terry Jones"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0334370/","name":"Kenneth Grahame"}],"duration":"PT1H28M"}</script><metacontent="

He and Rat start to fight to get his home back from evil Weasels." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0118172/","name":"The Wind in the Willows","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MTg4MzE4MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzY3NDUyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Mole's underground home is bought by the Weasels from wealthy landowner Mr. Toad and Mole is thrown out. He and Rat start to fight to get his home back from evil Weasels.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0118172/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird","dateCreated":"2009-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"I liked it, but I also felt it was a bit clumsy!","reviewBody":"Don't get me wrong, I did really like it, but like most films, there were a number of flaws that undermined what could have been a fun romp for kids. The first, and main problem, was the story. There were some times when it bared some resemblance to one of the best children's books ever written, up there with Peter Pan and the Hans Christian Anderson Fairy tales, for imagination and complexity. However, I especially disliked the dog meat factory subplot, that's where it got really clumsy and it made the climax feel really cluttered. The songs were also nothing to write home about. They were fun to listen to (especially the Weasel song), but they were definitely forgettable. The direction, by I think Terry Jones(also actor), lacked at times the director's usual silliness and fun. There were some scenes, like the train scene where the action felt a bit rushed.
