IMDb data; ttnr: 7715270, Title: Adoration, --- Description: Adoration: Directed by Fabrice du Welz. With Thomas Gioria, Fantine Harduin, Benoît Poelvoorde, Anaël Snoek. 12-year-old Paul lives an isolated existence with his mother, who works at a private psychiatric hospital in the woods near their house. One day, Paul encounters a young teen named Gloria, a mysterious new patient with whom he quickly becomes infatuated. As the fledgling pair forge a tentative friendship, Gloria convinces Paul to help her escape. But when they embark on a perilous journey together, his devotion is put to the test as Gloria's dangerous unpredictability gradually starts to surface." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7715270/","name":"Adoration","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDg5N2UyNjAtYzU3OC00OTU1LTk0MWItNTE0MGMxMTM5ZDNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzA4MDA0Mjc@._V1_.jpg","description":"12-year-old Paul lives an isolated existence with his mother, who works at a private psychiatric hospital in the woods near their house. One day, Paul encounters a young teen named Gloria, a mysterious new patient with whom he quickl","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7715270/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Victor_Fallon","dateCreated":"2021-09-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"Haute Cuisine for the screen - ie. you don't get very much to chew on.","reviewBody":"It looks nice. But it's the same tone from beginning to end, so becomes visually boring very quickly.

The acting is just ok - incredibly earnest with lots of 'emoting' going on to fill the vast distances between plot points or intrigue.

The story is a fairly typical young love drama. Our boy is inexperienced and because of this, he devotes himself to 'rescuing' our girl who is, like, totally crazy man. She's like, totally in an institution and the bad doctors give her sedatives and stuff. And then she y'know, like, says crazy things. She's like sooo crazy.

The writing of her character is unforgiveably weak. The boy slackens his jaw and gawps at her for most of the runtime. The film plods along predictably until it stubs its toe on the ending, which is neither tragic enough nor dramatic enough to matter. In fact, the ending is where the story should have begun. Everything up until that point could have been covered in two minutes.

Tedious, thematically transparent, metaphorically barren and in love with itself. Guff.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":879,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2,"genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-01-22","keywords":"one word title,no opening credits,young boy,bird,young girl","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3422862873","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzZkMjZjNTQtMDQwZS00MjVlLThlYWQtOTVmZmM3NWMyNzBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzZkMjZjNTQtMDQwZS00MjVlLThlYWQtOTVmZmM3NWMyNzBiXkEyXkFqcGdeQUlNRGJWaWRlb1RodW1ibmFpbFNlcnZpY2U@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8390021/","name":"Thomas Gioria","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6320366/","name":"Fantine Harduin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0688143/","name":"Benoît Poelvoorde"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0239001/","name":"Fabrice du Welz"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0448858/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0632419/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0282520/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0239001/","name":"Fabrice du Welz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1343281/","name":"Romain Protat","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0851759/","name":"Vincent Tavier"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

Bones
programme.desc: Bones: Created by Hart Hanson. With Emily Deschanel, David Boreanaz, Michaela Conlin, T.J. Thyne. Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0460627/","name":"Bones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3ODMxMzM5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM1NjU0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0460627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blondesis2u"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good blend of character relationship, plot, and occasional humor in horrific situations","reviewBody":"David Boreanaz and Emily Deschanel start well with better than two-dimensional characters in a fresh look at a CSI type show. Based on the real-life work of forensic anthropologist and novelist Kathy Reichs, it's fun, kicky, and only occasionally too gruesome to look at. Not quite like one of Ms. Reichs' novels, it is still a pleasure for a fan (me!) to watch. Boreanaz' past work on Buffy and Angel stands in good stead here as he delivers lines that stand up to a strong female role without diminishing it. Also like Buffy, humor lends grace to embarrassing social situations that highlight common human vulnerabilities. Surrounding the 2 major players are other characters who add to the thrust of a character driven show. The writers do good work giving each character unique attributes that have nothing to do with hair color or body measurements. The entire cast does a good job presenting real, quirky individuals who don't have to rely on looks to sell the worth of their character to the viewers. That alone is something new for any CSI show. Still some rough edges in writing and delivery (Tempe's "I wish this was the worst I have seen" was painful for all the wrong reasons),"Bones" has great potential."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148714,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-09-13","keywords":"forensic anthropologist,investigation,washington d.c.,crime scene investigation,murder investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221043/","name":"Emily Deschanel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174819/","name":"Michaela Conlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0361274/","name":"Hart Hanson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bones: The Complete Seventh Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi748140825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bones: The Complete Seventh Season"}}</script><metacontent="

Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0460627/","name":"Bones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3ODMxMzM5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM1NjU0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0460627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blondesis2u"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good blend of character relationship, plot, and occasional humor in horrific situations","reviewBody":"David Boreanaz and Emily Deschanel start well with better than two-dimensional characters in a fresh look at a CSI type show. Based on the real-life work of forensic anthropologist and novelist Kathy Reichs, it's fun, kicky, and only occasionally too gruesome to look at. Not quite like one of Ms. Reichs' novels, it is still a pleasure for a fan (me!) to watch. Boreanaz' past work on Buffy and Angel stands in good stead here as he delivers lines that stand up to a strong female role without diminishing it. Also like Buffy, humor lends grace to embarrassing social situations that highlight common human vulnerabilities. Surrounding the 2 major players are other characters who add to the thrust of a character driven show. The writers do good work giving each character unique attributes that have nothing to do with hair color or body measurements. The entire cast does a good job presenting real, quirky individuals who don't have to rely on looks to sell the worth of their character to the viewers. That alone is something new for any CSI show. Still some rough edges in writing and delivery (Tempe's "I wish this was the worst I have seen" was painful for all the wrong reasons),"Bones" has great potential."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148714,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-09-13","keywords":"forensic anthropologist,investigation,washington d.c.,crime scene investigation,murder investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221043/","name":"Emily Deschanel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174819/","name":"Michaela Conlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0361274/","name":"Hart Hanson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bones: The Complete Seventh Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi748140825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bones: The Complete Seventh Season"}}</script><metacontent="

Based on the real-life work of forensic anthropologist and novelist Kathy Reichs, it's fun, kicky, and only occasionally too gruesome to look at. Not quite like one of Ms. Reichs' novels, it is still a pleasure for a fan (me!) to watch. Boreanaz' past work on Buffy and Angel stands in good stead here as he delivers lines that stand up to a strong female role without diminishing it. Also like Buffy, humor lends grace to embarrassing social situations that highlight common human vulnerabilities. Surrounding the 2 major players are other characters who add to the thrust of a character driven show. The writers do good work giving each character unique attributes that have nothing to do with hair color or body measurements. The entire cast does a good job presenting real, quirky individuals who don't have to rely on looks to sell the worth of their character to the viewers. That alone is something new for any CSI show. Still some rough edges in writing and delivery (Tempe's "I wish this was the worst I have seen" was painful for all the wrong reasons),"Bones" has great potential."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148714,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-09-13","keywords":"forensic anthropologist,investigation,washington d.c.,crime scene investigation,murder investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221043/","name":"Emily Deschanel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174819/","name":"Michaela Conlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0361274/","name":"Hart Hanson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bones: The Complete Seventh Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi748140825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bones: The Complete Seventh Season"}}</script><metacontent="

Still some rough edges in writing and delivery (Tempe's "I wish this was the worst I have seen" was painful for all the wrong reasons),"Bones" has great potential."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148714,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-09-13","keywords":"forensic anthropologist,investigation,washington d.c.,crime scene investigation,murder investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221043/","name":"Emily Deschanel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174819/","name":"Michaela Conlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0361274/","name":"Hart Hanson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bones: The Complete Seventh Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi748140825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bones: The Complete Seventh Season"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 0460627, Title: Bones, --- Description: Bones: Created by Hart Hanson. With Emily Deschanel, David Boreanaz, Michaela Conlin, T.J. Thyne. Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0460627/","name":"Bones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3ODMxMzM5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM1NjU0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0460627/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"blondesis2u","dateCreated":"2005-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good blend of character relationship, plot, and occasional humor in horrific situations","reviewBody":"David Boreanaz and Emily Deschanel start well with better than two-dimensional characters in a fresh look at a CSI type show. Based on the real-life work of forensic anthropologist and novelist Kathy Reichs, it's fun, kicky, and only occasionally too gruesome to look at. Not quite like one of Ms. Reichs' novels, it is still a pleasure for a fan (me!) to watch. Boreanaz' past work on Buffy and Angel stands in good stead here as he delivers lines that stand up to a strong female role without diminishing it. Also like Buffy, humor lends grace to embarrassing social situations that highlight common human vulnerabilities. Surrounding the 2 major players are other characters who add to the thrust of a character driven show. The writers do good work giving each character unique attributes that have nothing to do with hair color or body measurements. The entire cast does a good job presenting real, quirky individuals who don't have to rely on looks to sell the worth of their character to the viewers. That alone is something new for any CSI show. Still some rough edges in writing and delivery (Tempe's "I wish this was the worst I have seen" was painful for all the wrong reasons),"Bones" has great potential.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148714,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-09-13","keywords":"forensic anthropologist,investigation,washington d.c.,crime scene investigation,murder investigation","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221043/","name":"Emily Deschanel","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174819/","name":"Michaela Conlin"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212869/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0361274/","name":"Hart Hanson"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bones: The Complete Seventh Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi748140825","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bones: The Complete Seventh Season"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chicago Med
Chicago Med
Chicago Med
programme.desc: Chicago Med: Created by Michael Brandt, Derek Haas, Matt Olmstead, Dick Wolf. With Nick Gehlfuss, Marlyne Barrett, S. Epatha Merkerson, Oliver Platt. The city's most highly skilled medical team saves lives, while navigating their unique interpersonal relationships." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt4655480/","name":"Chicago Med","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDUzNTBiZTUtZjBkOC00MzAyLTgxYTUtMjVkZDQ3MGUzNDE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The city's most highly skilled medical team saves lives, while navigating their unique interpersonal relationships.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4655480/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mel2718"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"An hour of entertaining tv","reviewBody":"I read other reviews slamming the show and everyone has a right to their opinion. My thought is, if you don't like it, don't watch it. I personally enjoy it, along with the Chicago franchise (Fire&PD). The crossover events are especially fun to watch. Is the use of accurate information on medication always correct? I can't say as I am not a doctor. I watch it because I like the characters and the stories. I'm sure there could be improvements, as with most tv. But this is not a documentary, its meant for entertainment. At least the characters have back stories. Lives outside the hospital. Dick Wolf has smartly created a network of series that all intermingle and its interesting to see how the New York shows come into play with the Chicago shows. So, just try it. And I don't mean to offend but to say it's like a soap opera is kinda funny to me because what is Grey's if not a soap? Most medical dramas have an element of such as well as miraculous cures at the end of the hour.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21196,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-11-17","keywords":"shared universe,doctor,emergency room,hospital,medical profession","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3674742/","name":"Nick Gehlfuss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012679/","name":"Marlyne Barrett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0580924/","name":"S. Epatha Merkerson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0019598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046592/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0104973/","name":"Michael Brandt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0351929/","name":"Derek Haas"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1631709/","name":"Matt Olmstead"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Chicago Med: Series","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2863249433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM1MmY5ZDYtNzM0Mi00OWU5LWIxYjYtODA1ZTlhY2FlMzgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjM1MmY5ZDYtNzM0Mi00OWU5LWIxYjYtODA1ZTlhY2FlMzgwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Series Premiere Trailer"}}</script><metacontent="

The city's most highly skilled medical team saves lives, while navigating their unique interpersonal relationships." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt4655480/","name":"Chicago Med","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDUzNTBiZTUtZjBkOC00MzAyLTgxYTUtMjVkZDQ3MGUzNDE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The city's most highly skilled medical team saves lives, while navigating their unique interpersonal relationships.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4655480/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"mel2718","dateCreated":"2020-04-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"An hour of entertaining tv","reviewBody":"I read other reviews slamming the show and everyone has a right to their opinion. My thought is, if you don't like it, don't watch it. I personally enjoy it, along with the Chicago franchise (Fire&PD). The crossover events are especially fun to watch. Is the use of accurate information on medication always correct? I can't say as I am not a doctor. I watch it because I like the characters and the stories. I'm sure there could be improvements, as with most tv. But this is not a documentary, its meant for entertainment. At least the characters have back stories. Lives outside the hospital. Dick Wolf has smartly created a network of series that all intermingle and its interesting to see how the New York shows come into play with the Chicago shows. So, just try it. And I don't mean to offend but to say it's like a soap opera is kinda funny to me because what is Grey's if not a soap? Most medical dramas have an element of such as well as miraculous cures at the end of the hour.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21196,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-11-17","keywords":"shared universe,doctor,emergency room,hospital,medical profession","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3674742/","name":"Nick Gehlfuss","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012679/","name":"Marlyne Barrett","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0580924/","name":"S. programme.title: Heat
Gorączka
Heat
programme.desc: Heat: Directed by Michael Mann. With Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer, Jon Voight. A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113277/","name":"Heat","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMwNzUwNjYtZWM5NS00YzMyLWI4NjAtNjM0ZDBiMzE1YWExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113277/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"aboriginee"},"dateCreated":"2000-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The best character film of all time.","reviewBody":"Sound like a bold statement? Devotees of classic cops and robbers flicks of old will no doubt take exception, but I believe that Michael Mann achieved some measure of perfection with Heat. To break this three-hour gem of a film down to its core, this is a film about men - strong men - and the supporting role that he women of the film have on them for better or worse. Take Pacino as good cop Vincent Hanna: one of the most intense characterizations of the tragic hero that I have ever witnessed, as he laments the demise of his third marriage to a pill-junkie wife. A fact which he discusses with his archnemesis (De Niro) in what history will regard as one of the most frenetic scenes in the history of film. The dialogue in this scene (at the very end of the first tape, if you own the VHS version) sets up the last half of the film beautifully, as our two rivals come to the joint realization that they have no hand in choosing the paths that will lead them to their ultimate confrontation: their very natures so define their respective actions that any attempt to do otherwise would simply be a waste of time. While I have heard others (who I am ashamed at times to call close friends) say that Heat drags in places, I will concede that there are moments in the film that require more than the cursory attention that they give to the movie they happen to be watching at any given time (I'm sorry not every director is Jerry Bruckheimer), there are poignant developments of character in Heat that many would casually disregard. I am thinking of the interaction between the ex-con who finds conditional employment in a diner with an opportunistic scum of a boss, and whose girlfriend is so proud of him for swallowing his pride and not simply giving the sonofabitch a good pummeling. But there is a catharsis that I felt for that same ex-con when De Niro's character presents him with the opportunity to take just one more score, for old time's sake. Who doesn't feel for this guy - this minor character in a film with big-time heavyweights who gets to shine for a few brief moments. That's what Heat is really: a series of brief moments, some touching, others traumatic, and still others incredibly horrifying in the feelings that they inspire in the romantic who, like me sees not black or white portrayals of protagonist and villain, but a montage of grays that combine to create a vivid spectrum of film characterization that could not be found in hundreds of films combined. One of my five favorite films of all time, Heat is a cinematic banquet of intense imagery and pulse-pounding action. Come hungry.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":616031,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1995-12-15","keywords":"gun battle,armored car robbery,gunfight,organized crime,honor","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Heat: Director's Definitive Edition","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi664516889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTdjMDhhNWMtNWQ3ZS00YTY1LTgzYjQtYmU1YjAzYmI2NGFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTdjMDhhNWMtNWQ3ZS00YTY1LTgzYjQtYmU1YjAzYmI2NGFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Clip: Splits"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000174/","name":"Val Kilmer"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000520/","name":"Michael Mann"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035930/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000520/","name":"Michael Mann"}],"duration":"PT2H50M"}</script><metacontent="

A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0113277/","name":"Heat","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGMwNzUwNjYtZWM5NS00YzMyLWI4NjAtNjM0ZDBiMzE1YWExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of high-end professional thieves start to feel the heat from the LAPD when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0113277/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"aboriginee","dateCreated":"2000-06-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"The best character film of all time.","reviewBody":"Sound like a bold statement? Devotees of classic cops and robbers flicks of old will no doubt take exception, but I believe that Michael Mann achieved some measure of perfection with Heat. To break this three-hour gem of a film down to its core, this is a film about men - strong men - and the supporting role that he women of the film have on them for better or worse. Take Pacino as good cop Vincent Hanna: one of the most intense characterizations of the tragic hero that I have ever witnessed, as he laments the demise of his third marriage to a pill-junkie wife. A fact which he discusses with his archnemesis (De Niro) in what history will regard as one of the most frenetic scenes in the history of film. The dialogue in this scene (at the very end of the first tape, if you own the VHS version) sets up the last half of the film beautifully, as our two rivals come to the joint realization that they have no hand in choosing the paths that will lead them to their ultimate confrontation: their very natures so define their respective actions that any attempt to do otherwise would simply be a waste of time. While I have heard others (who I am ashamed at times to call close friends) say that Heat drags in places, I will concede that there are moments in the film that require more than the cursory attention that they give to the movie they happen to be watching at any given time (I'm sorry not every director is Jerry Bruckheimer), there are poignant developments of character in Heat that many would casually disregard. I am thinking of the interaction between the ex-con who finds conditional employment in a diner with an opportunistic scum of a boss, and whose girlfriend is so proud of him for swallowing his pride and not simply giving the sonofabitch a good pummeling. But there is a catharsis that I felt for that same ex-con when De Niro's character presents him with the opportunity to take just one more score, for old time's sake. Who doesn't feel for this guy - this minor character in a film with big-time heavyweights who gets to shine for a few brief moments. That's what Heat is really: a series of brief moments, some touching, others traumatic, and still others incredibly horrifying in the feelings that they inspire in the romantic who, like me sees not black or white portrayals of protagonist and villain, but a montage of grays that combine to create a vivid spectrum of film characterization that could not be found in hundreds of films combined. One of my five favorite films of all time, Heat is a cinematic banquet of intense imagery and pulse-pounding action. Come hungry.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":616031,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"1995-12-15","keywords":"gun battle,armored car robbery,gunfight,organized crime,honor","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Heat: Director's Definitive Edition","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi664516889","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTdjMDhhNWMtNWQ3ZS00YTY1LTgzYjQtYmU1YjAzYmI2NGFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTdjMDhhNWMtNWQ3ZS00YTY1LTgzYjQtYmU1YjAzYmI2NGFhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Clip: Splits","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000174/","name":"Val Kilmer"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000520/","name":"Michael Mann"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002663/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035930/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000520/","name":"Michael Mann"],"duration":"PT2H50M"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Bones: Created by Hart Hanson. With Emily Deschanel, David Boreanaz, Michaela Conlin, T.J. Thyne. Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0460627/","name":"Bones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3ODMxMzM5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM1NjU0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0460627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blondesis2u"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good blend of character relationship, plot, and occasional humor in horrific situations","reviewBody":"David Boreanaz and Emily Deschanel start well with better than two-dimensional characters in a fresh look at a CSI type show. Based on the real-life work of forensic anthropologist and novelist Kathy Reichs, it's fun, kicky, and only occasionally too gruesome to look at. Not quite like one of Ms. Reichs' novels, it is still a pleasure for a fan (me!) to watch. Boreanaz' past work on Buffy and Angel stands in good stead here as he delivers lines that stand up to a strong female role without diminishing it. Also like Buffy, humor lends grace to embarrassing social situations that highlight common human vulnerabilities. Surrounding the 2 major players are other characters who add to the thrust of a character driven show. The writers do good work giving each character unique attributes that have nothing to do with hair color or body measurements. The entire cast does a good job presenting real, quirky individuals who don't have to rely on looks to sell the worth of their character to the viewers. That alone is something new for any CSI show. Still some rough edges in writing and delivery (Tempe's "I wish this was the worst I have seen" was painful for all the wrong reasons),"Bones" has great potential."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148714,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-09-13","keywords":"forensic anthropologist,investigation,washington d.c.,crime scene investigation,murder investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221043/","name":"Emily Deschanel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174819/","name":"Michaela Conlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0361274/","name":"Hart Hanson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bones: The Complete Seventh Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi748140825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bones: The Complete Seventh Season"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Bones: Created by Hart Hanson. With Emily Deschanel, David Boreanaz, Michaela Conlin, T.J. Thyne. Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0460627/","name":"Bones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3ODMxMzM5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM1NjU0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0460627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blondesis2u"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good blend of character relationship, plot, and occasional humor in horrific situations","reviewBody":"David Boreanaz and Emily Deschanel start well with better than two-dimensional characters in a fresh look at a CSI type show. Based on the real-life work of forensic anthropologist and novelist Kathy Reichs, it's fun, kicky, and only occasionally too gruesome to look at. Not quite like one of Ms. Reichs' novels, it is still a pleasure for a fan (me!) to watch. Boreanaz' past work on Buffy and Angel stands in good stead here as he delivers lines that stand up to a strong female role without diminishing it. Also like Buffy, humor lends grace to embarrassing social situations that highlight common human vulnerabilities. Surrounding the 2 major players are other characters who add to the thrust of a character driven show. The writers do good work giving each character unique attributes that have nothing to do with hair color or body measurements. The entire cast does a good job presenting real, quirky individuals who don't have to rely on looks to sell the worth of their character to the viewers. That alone is something new for any CSI show. Still some rough edges in writing and delivery (Tempe's "I wish this was the worst I have seen" was painful for all the wrong reasons),"Bones" has great potential."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148714,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-09-13","keywords":"forensic anthropologist,investigation,washington d.c.,crime scene investigation,murder investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221043/","name":"Emily Deschanel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174819/","name":"Michaela Conlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0361274/","name":"Hart Hanson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bones: The Complete Seventh Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi748140825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bones: The Complete Seventh Season"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Bones: Created by Hart Hanson. With Emily Deschanel, David Boreanaz, Michaela Conlin, T.J. Thyne. Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0460627/","name":"Bones","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA3ODMxMzM5NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDM1NjU0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Forensic anthropologist Dr. Temperance "Bones" Brennan and cocky F.B.I. Special Agent Seeley Booth build a team to investigate murders. Quite often, there isn't more to examine than rotten flesh or mere bones.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0460627/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"blondesis2u"},"dateCreated":"2005-09-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good blend of character relationship, plot, and occasional humor in horrific situations","reviewBody":"David Boreanaz and Emily Deschanel start well with better than two-dimensional characters in a fresh look at a CSI type show. Based on the real-life work of forensic anthropologist and novelist Kathy Reichs, it's fun, kicky, and only occasionally too gruesome to look at. Not quite like one of Ms. Reichs' novels, it is still a pleasure for a fan (me!) to watch. Boreanaz' past work on Buffy and Angel stands in good stead here as he delivers lines that stand up to a strong female role without diminishing it. Also like Buffy, humor lends grace to embarrassing social situations that highlight common human vulnerabilities. Surrounding the 2 major players are other characters who add to the thrust of a character driven show. The writers do good work giving each character unique attributes that have nothing to do with hair color or body measurements. The entire cast does a good job presenting real, quirky individuals who don't have to rely on looks to sell the worth of their character to the viewers. That alone is something new for any CSI show. Still some rough edges in writing and delivery (Tempe's "I wish this was the worst I have seen" was painful for all the wrong reasons),"Bones" has great potential."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":148714,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2005-09-13","keywords":"forensic anthropologist,investigation,washington d.c.,crime scene investigation,murder investigation","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0221043/","name":"Emily Deschanel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004770/","name":"David Boreanaz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174819/","name":"Michaela Conlin"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0212869/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046572/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056447/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0361274/","name":"Hart Hanson"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bones: The Complete Seventh Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi748140825","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDA2MGRiODItYWI4Zi00ODdhLTg0OWYtMDQ1NmIyODQ2ZGNlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Bones: The Complete Seventh Season"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Chicago Med
Chicago Med
Chicago Med
programme.desc: Chicago Med: Created by Michael Brandt, Derek Haas, Matt Olmstead, Dick Wolf. With Nick Gehlfuss, Marlyne Barrett, S. Epatha Merkerson, Oliver Platt. The city's most highly skilled medical team saves lives, while navigating their unique interpersonal relationships." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt4655480/","name":"Chicago Med","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDUzNTBiZTUtZjBkOC00MzAyLTgxYTUtMjVkZDQ3MGUzNDE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODUxOTU0OTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"The city's most highly skilled medical team saves lives, while navigating their unique interpersonal relationships.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4655480/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"mel2718"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"An hour of entertaining tv","reviewBody":"I read other reviews slamming the show and everyone has a right to their opinion. My thought is, if you don't like it, don't watch it. I personally enjoy it, along with the Chicago franchise (Fire&PD). The crossover events are especially fun to watch. Is the use of accurate information on medication always correct? I can't say as I am not a doctor. I watch it because I like the characters and the stories. I'm sure there could be improvements, as with most tv. But this is not a documentary, its meant for entertainment. At least the characters have back stories. Lives outside the hospital. Dick Wolf has smartly created a network of series that all intermingle and its interesting to see how the New York shows come into play with the Chicago shows. So, just try it. And I don't mean to offend but to say it's like a soap opera is kinda funny to me because what is Grey's if not a soap? Most medical dramas have an element of such as well as miraculous cures at the end of the hour.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":21196,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-11-17","keywords":"shared universe,doctor,emergency room,hospital,medical profession","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3674742/","name":"Nick Gehlfuss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0012679/","name":"Marlyne Barrett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0580924/","name":"S. The Girl Next Door
programme.desc:
The Girl Next Door: Directed by Luke Greenfield. With Emile Hirsch, Elisha Cuthbert, Timothy Olyphant, James Remar. A teenager's dreams come true when a former porn star moves in next door and they fall in love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0265208/","name":"The Girl Next Door","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0ODIyMzE1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODEwODczMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager's dreams come true when a former porn star moves in next door and they fall in love.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0265208/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cariart"},"dateCreated":"2004-10-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Engaging Homage to 80's Teen Flicks...","reviewBody":"THE GIRL NEXT DOOR, Luke Greenfield's sexy yet sweet teen angst flick, owes a lot to both the RISKY BUSINESS premise (HS Senior, his goal a prestigious college, has his life turned 'upside-down' by world-wise 'Pro'), and the internal structure of John Hughes' 80's teen 'classics' (geeky hero, and his two geekier friends, gain acceptance and prestige through his relationship with a 'dream girl').

Close your eyes, and you could easily picture the young Anthony Michael Hall or John Cusack filling Emile Hirsch's role, with Rebecca De Mornay or Kelly Preston replacing Elisha Cuthbert as his ex-porn star girlfriend. THE GIRL NEXT DOOR, however, actually works quite well, thanks to Greenfield's 'tongue-in-cheek' approach to the naughtiness, and a flawless supporting cast, particularly Timothy Olyphant as a likable but ultimately ruthless porn producer, and Timothy Bottoms and Donna Bullock, as Hirsch's clueless but blindly supportive parents. 

Emile Hirsch shows a propensity towards 'soulfully earnest' expressions, but does provide one of the film's funniest scenes, as, while high on Ecstasy, he attempts to navigate through a crowd awaiting his speech on 'high moral fiber'. While some critics tended to brush off Elisha Cuthbert's performance as just another skin-baring 'boy toy' variation, she actually conveys the vulnerability and pain of her character's past quite effectively, balancing it with sly humor and a LOT of 'sex appeal', done within the restraints of her "No Nudity" contract clause...Sorry, guys, while you'll see a LOT of her skin, you AREN'T going to see Elisha 'bare all'...

The film is a very funny, breezy lark, and while it never achieves the heights of insanity of RISKY BUSINESS, it certainly stands as one of the better 'teen' comedies of the past few years!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":216785,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-04-09","keywords":"porn actress,forced to strip,female nudity,wet clothes,voyeur","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Girl Next Door","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3404857625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTdhYmMyNGMtNDlmZS00NTkzLWE5ZTMtYmRiMmVkOWYzM2M4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTdhYmMyNGMtNDlmZS00NTkzLWE5ZTMtYmRiMmVkOWYzM2M4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0386472/","name":"Emile Hirsch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0236202/","name":"Nicholas Downs"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193846/","name":"Elisha Cuthbert"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339004/","name":"Luke Greenfield"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010747/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0166202/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0905858/","name":"David Wagner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0325166/","name":"Brent Goldberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089742/","name":"Stuart Blumberg"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 0265208, Title: The Girl Next Door, --- Description: The Girl Next Door: Directed by Luke Greenfield. With Emile Hirsch, Elisha Cuthbert, Timothy Olyphant, James Remar. A teenager's dreams come true when a former porn star moves in next door and they fall in love." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0265208/","name":"The Girl Next Door","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ0ODIyMzE1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwODEwODczMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A teenager's dreams come true when a former porn star moves in next door and they fall in love.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0265208/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"cariart","dateCreated":"2004-10-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Engaging Homage to 80's Teen Flicks...","reviewBody":"THE GIRL NEXT DOOR, Luke Greenfield's sexy yet sweet teen angst flick, owes a lot to both the RISKY BUSINESS premise (HS Senior, his goal a prestigious college, has his life turned 'upside-down' by world-wise 'Pro'), and the internal structure of John Hughes' 80's teen 'classics' (geeky hero, and his two geekier friends, gain acceptance and prestige through his relationship with a 'dream girl').

Close your eyes, and you could easily picture the young Anthony Michael Hall or John Cusack filling Emile Hirsch's role, with Rebecca De Mornay or Kelly Preston replacing Elisha Cuthbert as his ex-porn star girlfriend. THE GIRL NEXT DOOR, however, actually works quite well, thanks to Greenfield's 'tongue-in-cheek' approach to the naughtiness, and a flawless supporting cast, particularly Timothy Olyphant as a likable but ultimately ruthless porn producer, and Timothy Bottoms and Donna Bullock, as Hirsch's clueless but blindly supportive parents. 

Emile Hirsch shows a propensity towards 'soulfully earnest' expressions, but does provide one of the film's funniest scenes, as, while high on Ecstasy, he attempts to navigate through a crowd awaiting his speech on 'high moral fiber'. While some critics tended to brush off Elisha Cuthbert's performance as just another skin-baring 'boy toy' variation, she actually conveys the vulnerability and pain of her character's past quite effectively, balancing it with sly humor and a LOT of 'sex appeal', done within the restraints of her "No Nudity" contract clause...Sorry, guys, while you'll see a LOT of her skin, you AREN'T going to see Elisha 'bare all'...

The film is a very funny, breezy lark, and while it never achieves the heights of insanity of RISKY BUSINESS, it certainly stands as one of the better 'teen' comedies of the past few years!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":216785,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2004-04-09","keywords":"porn actress,forced to strip,female nudity,wet clothes,voyeur","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Girl Next Door","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3404857625","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTdhYmMyNGMtNDlmZS00NTkzLWE5ZTMtYmRiMmVkOWYzM2M4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTdhYmMyNGMtNDlmZS00NTkzLWE5ZTMtYmRiMmVkOWYzM2M4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0386472/","name":"Emile Hirsch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0236202/","name":"Nicholas Downs","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0193846/","name":"Elisha Cuthbert"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0339004/","name":"Luke Greenfield"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0007127/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0010747/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0166202/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0905858/","name":"David Wagner","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0325166/","name":"Brent Goldberg","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089742/","name":"Stuart Blumberg"],"duration":"PT1H49M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Stuck on You
Skazani na siebie
Stuck on You
programme.desc:
Stuck on You: Directed by Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly. With Matt Damon, Greg Kinnear, Eva Mendes, Wen Yann Shih. Conjoined twins from Martha's Vineyard move to Los Angeles so that one of them can pursue an acting career." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338466/","name":"Stuck on You","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYwODE1MTc3NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjQxMzQyMQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Conjoined twins from Martha's Vineyard move to Los Angeles so that one of them can pursue an acting career.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338466/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ghonzo"},"dateCreated":"2004-02-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A surprisingly effective comedy","reviewBody":"This turned out to be a surprisingly effective comedy. Okay, sure, you can say that a movie that pokes fun at conjoined twins is in poor taste, but there's nothing malicious about it -- it feels, if you can believe it, genuine.

You really get a sense of the tenderness and the bond that has developed between the two brothers. Of course, as you'd expect from the Farrelly brothers, it's laugh-out-loud funny. As you might not expect, there's not really any gross-out humor: it's more "Hal" than "Mary". If you can't tell, I was pleasantly surprised by this movie.

Some gag highlights: Cher with her boyfriends, Matt Damon's stage fright, Greg Kinnear in a animal costume.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52347,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.7},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2004-02-18","keywords":"internet,conjoined twins,motel,porn star,2000s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Stuck on You","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2374481433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5NzY2MzE4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI0MjYyMDI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU5NzY2MzE4M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTI0MjYyMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Stuck on You"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000354/","name":"Matt Damon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001427/","name":"Greg Kinnear"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578949/","name":"Eva Mendes"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030016/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0921853/","name":"Charles B. programme.title: The Virtuoso
Wirtuoz. Pojedynek zabójców
The Virtuoso
programme.desc:
The Virtuoso: Directed by Nick Stagliano. With Anson Mount, Abbie Cornish, Anthony Hopkins, David Morse. Danger, deception and murder descend upon a sleepy town when a professional assassin accepts a new assignment from his enigmatic boss." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4136456/","name":"The Virtuoso","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ3NjkyNGMtMmVkZS00ZGQ0LTgyMjgtNmY1YTAzN2NlM2EzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Danger, deception and murder descend upon a sleepy town when a professional assassin accepts a new assignment from his enigmatic boss.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4136456/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"solminafya"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Messy plot, predictable twist, and very shallow characters","reviewBody":"Ok, at first I got hooked by the trailer, which set me to expect something good out of this movie, and by Anthony Hopkins, who's (usually) a safe bet. And it was a mistake, I admit!

All characters are pretty flat and shallow, dialogue is superficial and performance is disengaging (specially Abbie Cornish!), and sequence of event's does not make any sense

Put all of that aside. Finishing the movie in retrospect I asked myself: WTF just happened??? The only answer my super ego dictated was that I wasted another 1:30 hrs of my life due to not responding to my gut feeling that it's a trap!

I really wanted to like this movie, but I couldn't. 5 stars for cinematography and Hopkins performance, zero for everything else except Abbie Cornish's performance that is -2!

If you find this review unhelpful (which is a sorta true) then imagine your disappointment when you watch this movie! Given only where and when along with a cryptic clue, the methodical hit man must identify his mysterious mark from among several possible targets, including a local sheriff (David Morse). Danger, deception and murder descend upon a sleepy town when a professional assassin accepts a new assignment from his enigmatic boss." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4136456/","name":"The Virtuoso","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjQ3NjkyNGMtMmVkZS00ZGQ0LTgyMjgtNmY1YTAzN2NlM2EzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Danger, deception and murder descend upon a sleepy town when a professional assassin accepts a new assignment from his enigmatic boss.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4136456/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"solminafya","dateCreated":"2021-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Messy plot, predictable twist, and very shallow characters","reviewBody":"Ok, at first I got hooked by the trailer, which set me to expect something good out of this movie, and by Anthony Hopkins, who's (usually) a safe bet. And it was a mistake, I admit!

All characters are pretty flat and shallow, dialogue is superficial and performance is disengaging (specially Abbie Cornish!), and sequence of event's does not make any sense

Put all of that aside. Finishing the movie in retrospect I asked myself: WTF just happened??? The only answer my super ego dictated was that I wasted another 1:30 hrs of my life due to not responding to my gut feeling that it's a trap!

I really wanted to like this movie, but I couldn't. 5 stars for cinematography and Hopkins performance, zero for everything else except Abbie Cornish's performance that is -2!

If you find this review unhelpful (which is a sorta true) then imagine your disappointment when you watch this movie! programme.title: 10 Cloverfield Lane
Cloverfield Lane 10
10 Cloverfield Lane
programme.desc:
10 Cloverfield Lane: Directed by Dan Trachtenberg. With John Goodman, Mary Elizabeth Winstead, John Gallagher Jr., Douglas M. Griffin. A young woman is held in an underground bunker by a man who insists that a hostile event has left the surface of the Earth uninhabitable." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1179933/","name":"10 Cloverfield Lane","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjEzMjczOTIxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTUwMjI3NzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A young woman is held in an underground bunker by a man who insists that a hostile event has left the surface of the Earth uninhabitable.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1179933/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"purrlgurrl"},"dateCreated":"2016-07-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"What are people throwing shade on this movie?","reviewBody":"Pluses: 1. Great cast. Really good chemistry among them. Terrific performances from all. Mary Elizabeth Winstead gets better with every film she makes. 2. Story keeps you guessing until the end. 3. There are references in it to some popular films in the genre (that are likely film maker favorites) from the past 30 years or so. 4. Director shows great promise while still early in his career. 4. Story more important than special effects or pointless action sequences (always a plus for me). 5. Sound effects, usually unappreciated in non-action films, well used to add to the intensity of the drama.

Minuses: 1. We've probably all seen John Goodman play a similar character before. 2. There's a possible murder that took place prior to the film, a plot device never resolved.

Since the film has the word "Cloverfield" in the title, a lot of dim light bulbs thought this was a prequel or sequel to the other film and bad mouthed it because it isn't. Using Cloverfield in the title was likely just another reference to a favorite film.

Some people didn't understand the ending. Huh? They must have fallen asleep during the rest of the movie (when they realized it wasn't Cloverfield 2) or this generation is dumber than I fear it might be. The actions of Winstead's character at the end of the film make perfect sense in light of a monologue she delivered earlier, which apparently was ignored by those whining about the ending.

Don't listen to the naysayers. It isn't high art, but it's an entertaining film that will hold your attention to the end.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":308336,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Horror"],"datePublished":"2016-03-30","keywords":"bunker,kidnapping,alien,minimal cast,alien invasion","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2229122329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIxMTU4NTMzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkxMTMwODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzIxMTU4NTMzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjkxMTMwODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Waking up from a car accident, a young woman finds herself in the basement of a man who says he's saved her life from a chemical attack that has left the outside uninhabitable."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000422/","name":"John Goodman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0935541/","name":"Mary Elizabeth Winstead"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0302330/","name":"John Gallagher Jr."}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0870469/","name":"Dan Trachtenberg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0021593/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0045450/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1061091/","name":"Josh Campbell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1173295/","name":"Matthew Stuecken"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3227090/","name":"Damien Chazelle"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: All the Way
Do końca
All the Way
programme.desc:
All the Way: Directed by Jay Roach. With Bryan Cranston, Anthony Mackie, Melissa Leo, Frank Langella. Lyndon B. Johnson becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of John F. Kennedy's assassination, and spends his first year in office fighting to pass the Civil Rights Act." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3791216/","name":"All the Way","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzUwMTRmMjYtNjI0ZC00Mzc3LTgyZGQtZTA5OTg5ZmVkZDMxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDQzMDg4Nzk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lyndon B. Johnson becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of John F. Kennedy's assassination, and spends his first year in office fighting to pass the Civil Rights Act.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3791216/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"secondtake"},"dateCreated":"2016-05-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cranston is great, and the events are even greater....","reviewBody":"All the Way

An impressive cast, centered around the LBJ actor Bryan Cranston, keeps the historical facts alive and relevant.

We often forget Johnson the president between Kennedy and Nixon. He was the most responsible for Vietnam, but also for a huge range of social programs that really make him the ultimate big government guy since Roosevelt. But important programs like Medicare and social legislation like the Civil Rights Act and the Voting Act. Seeing him struggle to make it happen is a kind of poker game, and he does it with famously Johnson candor and humor.

There's no getting around the fact that these are facts. There are no dramatic surprises here (so it's like seeing a movie the second time). But it's a good movie—one that you can see a second time and get a lot from it. There are weak points (some miscast figures like, unfortunately, Martin Luther King Jr. who is played by Anthony Mackie), but overall the drama of the events is kept intense and pertinent.

And Cranston is sublime. If you know him from "Breaking Bad" you will surprised by his depth here. See him, at least. And Johnson, too.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":13876,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.3},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"2016-05-21","keywords":"j. edgar hoover character,lyndon b. johnson character,jacqueline kennedy character,dallas texas,year 1963","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3039999001","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwMjk5MzI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzMwMjk5MzI3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMDYwODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lyndon B. Johnson (Bryan Cranston) becomes the President of the United States in the chaotic aftermath of JFK's assassination and spends his first year in office to quickly pass the Civil Rights Act."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186505/","name":"Bryan Cranston"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1107001/","name":"Anthony Mackie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0502425/","name":"Melissa Leo"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005366/","name":"Jay Roach"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005861/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0009119/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0490948/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0770938/","name":"Robert Schenkkan"}],"duration":"PT2H12M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Frozen
Kraina lodu
Frozen
programme.desc: Frozen: Directed by Chris Buck, Jennifer Lee. With Kristen Bell, Idina Menzel, Jonathan Groff, Josh Gad. When the newly crowned Queen Elsa accidentally uses her power to turn things into ice to curse her home in infinite winter, her sister Anna teams up with a mountain man, his playful reindeer, and a snowman to change the weather condition." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2294629/","name":"Frozen","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ1MjQwMTE5OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk3MTcyMDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When the newly crowned Queen Elsa accidentally uses her power to turn things into ice to curse her home in infinite winter, her sister Anna teams up with a mountain man, his playful reindeer, and a snowman to change the weather condi","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2294629/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"diego-echeverria"},"dateCreated":"2013-11-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Deserves the Oscar","reviewBody":"Frozen is a blast of a movie with hilarious moments, dark meaning and emotional message. You will cry, laugh and feel amazing after watching this Oscar deserving movie. With some of the best spontaneous singing I've seen in Disney, this musical movie is also a pleasure to your mouse ears. This is probably the best animated movie I've seen this year, simply marvelous and excellent. The Disney familiar concepts of love and bravery are demonstrated, as well as kindness, determination, the horrors of your fears and stress and the meaning of "true love". This movie is guaranteed to make you crack as smile with the hilarious little snowman called "Olaf", who is probably my favorite character in the movie. A bit darker than most Disney films, it will also touch and amuse even teenagers. This movie has the same kind of humor as the last movie from these creators, Wreck-it Ralph (which is also one of my Disney favorites, explaining why I love this one). You will cry, laugh and feel amazing after watching this Oscar deserving movie. With some of the best spontaneous singing I've seen in Disney, this musical movie is also a pleasure to your mouse ears. This is probably the best animated movie I've seen this year, simply marvelous and excellent. The Disney familiar concepts of love and bravery are demonstrated, as well as kindness, determination, the horrors of your fears and stress and the meaning of "true love". This movie is guaranteed to make you crack as smile with the hilarious little snowman called "Olaf", who is probably my favorite character in the movie. A bit darker than most Disney films, it will also touch and amuse even teenagers. This movie has the same kind of humor as the last movie from these creators, Wreck-it Ralph (which is also one of my Disney favorites, explaining why I love this one). Frozen II
programme.desc:
Frozen II: Directed by Chris Buck, Jennifer Lee. With Kristen Bell, Idina Menzel, Josh Gad, Jonathan Groff. Anna, Elsa, Kristoff, Olaf and Sven leave Arendelle to travel to an ancient, autumn-bound forest of an enchanted land. They set out to find the origin of Elsa's powers in order to save their kingdom." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4520988/","name":"Frozen II","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0YjYyZGMtN2U0Ni00YmY4LWJkZTItYTMyMjY3NGYyMTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDg4NjY5OTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Anna, Elsa, Kristoff, Olaf and Sven leave Arendelle to travel to an ancient, autumn-bound forest of an enchanted land. They set out to find the origin of Elsa's powers in order to save their kingdom.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4520988/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Gunsjoe"},"dateCreated":"2019-11-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Somehow they've gone a bit backwards","reviewBody":"This movie has beautiful visuals. The scenes and animation is breathtaking. I liked that very much.

Here's a controversial opinion; I quite liked the music and songs as well though It lacks the iconic catchy tunes from the first one.

My biggest complaint and the one thing that let this down is the story. Its way too simplistic. Now granted the first one wasn't Mark-Twain like either but you get the feeling that it was more substantial than this and as an adult there was more in the first one for you than this.

I'm still rating this pretty good because as much as I'm personally underwhelmed by the story, I'm not the target audience. This is a movie for little children and I guess they might have a different opinion. I wouldn't know for sure since I dont have children to take to the movies. I would like to, but I need to find a wife first for that to happen.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":154425,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2019-11-22","keywords":"autumn,anthropomorphic snowman,princess,disney animated sequel,magic","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Frozen II Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2143993625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmNkNWYwYzItNzJhMi00YjljLTkxODMtODRlODQ2ZWE1ZTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmNkNWYwYzItNzJhMi00YjljLTkxODMtODRlODQ2ZWE1ZTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0068338/","name":"Kristen Bell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0579953/","name":"Idina Menzel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1265802/","name":"Josh Gad"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0118333/","name":"Chris Buck"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1601644/","name":"Jennifer Lee"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0074039/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0008970/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1601644/","name":"Jennifer Lee"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026153/","name":"Hans Christian Andersen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0118333/","name":"Chris Buck"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="
